pediatia: <entryFree id="n34335" type="main" key="Pe^di^a_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕdĭātĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n34335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nickname of the Roman knight</hi> J. Pediatius, <hi rend="ital">on account of his effeminacy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pedica: <entryFree id="n34336" type="main" key="pe^di^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pes</etym>, <sense id="n34336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shackle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetter</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">chain for the feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a springe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snare</hi> (cf.: compes, vinculum tendicula). </sense><sense id="n34336.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc gruibus pedicas et retia ponere cervis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 307</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 473</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 5, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid, si pedes pedicis coartentur?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 357, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34336.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the spider's web, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34336.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a shackle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetter</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">amoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 116, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl></cit>, p. 182, 41.</sense></entryFree>
pedicellus: <entryFree id="n34337" type="hapax" key="pe^di_cellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdīcellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pediculus</etym>, <sense id="n34337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little louse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 57</bibl> dub. (al. peduclum).</sense></entryFree>
pedicinus: <entryFree id="n34338" type="main" key="pe^di^ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdĭcĭnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pes</etym>, <sense id="n34338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the foot of a press</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pediclus: <entryFree id="n34339" type="main" key="pe^di_clus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdīclus</orth>, v. pediculus.</entryFree>
pedico: <entryFree id="n34340" type="main" key="pe_di_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēdīco</orth>, etc., v. paedico, etc.</entryFree>
pedicosus: <entryFree id="n34341" type="hapax" key="pe^di_co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdīcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pedis</etym>, <sense id="n34341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of lice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lousy</hi>, Titin. ap. Fest. s. v. pedibus, p. 210 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
pedicularis: <entryFree id="n34342" type="main" key="pe^di_cu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdīcŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pediculus</etym>, <sense id="n34342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to lice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pedicular</hi>: herba pedicularis, <hi rend="ital">lousewort</hi> (so called because it kills lice), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:30:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 30, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. 1. pedicularius: morbus,</quote> <trans><tr>the lousy distemper</tr>, <tr>phthiriasis</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 3, 564</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pedicularius: <entryFree id="n34343" type="main" key="pe^di_cu^la_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdīcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to lice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pedicular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">staphis agria, quam herbam pediculariam quidam vocant, quod pediculos necat,</quote> <trans><tr>lousewort</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 166" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 166</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34344" type="gloss" key="pe^di_cu^la_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdīcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">suntona/rios</foreign>, <sense id="n34344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who pressed the</hi> scabellum <hi rend="ital">with his foot</hi>, qs. <hi rend="ital">a time-marker</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
pediculatio: <entryFree id="n34345" type="gloss" key="pe^di_cu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdīcŭlātĭo</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">fqeiri/asis</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
pediculo: <entryFree id="n34346" type="gloss" key="pe^di_cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdīcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <foreign lang="greek">fqeiri/zw</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
pediculosus: <entryFree id="n34347" type="main" key="pe^di_cu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdīcŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pediculus</etym>, <sense id="n34347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of lice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lousy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:59:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 59, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pediculus: <entryFree id="n34348" type="main" key="pe^di_cu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdīcŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pĕdīclus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pes</etym>, <sense id="n34348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little foot.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34348.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pediculi octoni omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 28, 44, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:33" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34348.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the foot-stalk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pedicle</hi> of a fruit or leaf: <cit><quote lang="la">pediculi Punicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:44:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 44, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:43:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 43, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pediculo brevi sunt folia oleae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 24, 38, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fungorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 23, 47, § 96</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1324" /> <cb n="PEDU" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34349" type="main" key="pe^di_cu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdīcŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pĕdūc-, pĕdunc-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pedis</etym>, <sense id="n34349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a louse</hi>: qui inter pilos palpebrarum pediculi nascuntur: id <foreign lang="greek">fqeiri/asin</foreign> Graeci nominant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ocimi cibus pediculos facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 12, 48, § 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 7</bibl>: pediculi terrae, <hi rend="ital">another name for the</hi> scarabaei terrestres, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 5, 12, § 39</bibl>.—In the form peduculus: <cit><quote lang="la">(marini),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 25, § 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:89" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 8, 28, § 89</bibl>; Pelag. Vet. 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; cf.: peduculus, <foreign lang="greek">fqei/r</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">pulex, cimex, peduculus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 176</bibl></cit>.—Form pedunculus, Pelag. 1, 1.</sense></entryFree>
pediolus: <entryFree id="n34350" type="main" key="pe^di^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. petiolus.</entryFree>
pedis: <entryFree id="n34351" type="main" key="pe^dis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>pes</etym>, <sense id="n34351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a louse</hi>: est pedis unus ingens in naso, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 220, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e capite et e collo eorum crebro eligendi pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: ubi quamque pedem videbat, Plaut. Vidular. Fragm. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:220:28" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 220, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes pulicesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Curc. 4:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit> (cited ap. Fest. s. v. pedibus, p. 210 Müll.); Lucil. ap. Fest. l. l.: pulicesne an cimices an pedes, Liv. Andron. ib.</sense></entryFree>
pedisequa: <entryFree id="n34352" type="main" key="pe^di^se^qua"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdĭsĕqua</orth>, v. pedisequus.</entryFree>
pedisequus: <entryFree id="n34353" type="main" key="pe^di^se^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdĭsĕquus</orth>, and lesscorrectly <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdis-sĕquus</orth>, old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdĭsĕcus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pes-sequor</etym>, <sense id="n34353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that follows on foot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">SERVVS PEDISSEQVVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 928, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdĭsĕquus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a male attendant; a footman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">man-servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">page</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lackey;</hi> and, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdĭsĕqua</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female attendant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a waiting-woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:67" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:1:17" default="NO">34, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:4:59" default="NO">40, 4, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gnatae pedissequa nutrix anus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 10, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem, uniones, pedisequos et cetera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 5, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamore pedisequorum nostrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba pedisequorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit> prooem. 12.—Comically: <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Sequere hac me. <hi rend="ital">Py.</hi> Pedisecus tibi sum, <hi rend="ital">I'll follow at your heels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34353.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a follower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attendant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istam juris scientiam eloquentiae tamquam ancillulam pedisequamque adjunxisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix satis idoneae (divitiae) tibi videbuntur, quae virtutis pedisequae sint,</quote> <trans><tr>the handmaids of virtue</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 14, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientem quippe pedisequum et imitatorem dei dicimus et sequi arbitramur deum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 25, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peditastellus: <entryFree id="n34354" type="main" key="pe^di^tastellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdĭtastellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>peditaster, not in use; formed like parasitaster, etc.; cf.: magistellus, cultellus, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n34354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wretched foot-soldier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tramp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at peditastelli quia erant, sivi viverent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
peditatus: <entryFree id="n34355" type="main" key="pe^di^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdĭtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pedes</etym>, <sense id="n34355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foot-soldiers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infantry</hi> (opp. equitatus, cavalry): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem peditatu, equitatu, copiis instruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatum peditatumque cogere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: peditatibus et equitatibus celeriter iter faciens, Auct. B. Hisp. 37.</sense></entryFree>
pedito: <entryFree id="n34356" type="gloss" key="pe^di^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go on foot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes, peditat, peditatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 75</bibl></cit>: pedito, <foreign lang="greek">pezeu/w</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
peditum: <entryFree id="n34357" type="main" key="pe_di^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēdĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. 2. pedo.</entryFree>
pedius: <entryFree id="n34358" type="main" key="Pe^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕdĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n34358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. —So, </sense><sense id="n34358.1" n="I" level="1"> Q. Pedius, <hi rend="ital">a joint-heir with Augustus to Cœsar's estate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:65:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 65, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34358.2" n="II" level="1"> Q. Pedius, <hi rend="ital">grandson of the former</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born dumb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">became a great painter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 4, 7, § 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pedo: <entryFree id="n34359" type="main" key="pe^do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pes</etym>, <sense id="n34359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to foot</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to furnish with feet;</hi> hence, * </sense><sense id="n34359.1" n="I" level="1"> Male pedatus, <hi rend="ital">ill set on his feet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 12</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n34359.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To prop up trees</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineae pedandae cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34360" type="main" key="pe_do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēdo</orth>, <itype>pĕpēdi</itype> (pēdĭtum), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>for perdo, Sanscr. root pard-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pe/rdw, pordh/</foreign>; cf. Germ. Furz; Engl. fart</etym>, <sense id="n34360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break wind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:14:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 14, 10</bibl>.—<mood>Part.</mood> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pēdĭtum</orth>, = crepitus ventris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:54:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 54, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34361" type="main" key="pe^do3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pes</etym>, <sense id="n34361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has broad feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a splay-foot</hi>: pedo, plancus, <foreign lang="greek">platu/pous</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34362" type="main" key="Pe^do4" n="4"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕdo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname.</hi> —Esp., </sense><sense id="n34362.1" n="1" level="3"> M. Juventius Pedo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:38:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 38, 107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34362.2" n="2" level="3"> C. Pedo Albinovanus, <hi rend="ital">a poet;</hi> v. Albinovanus.—Others are mentioned, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:129" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:5:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:19:10" default="NO">10, 19, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pedocucullus: <entryFree id="n34363" type="gloss" key="pe^docucullus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdocucullus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering for the feet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedocucullus, cuculluspedo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 157</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peducaeus: <entryFree id="n34364" type="main" key="Pe^du_caeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕdūcaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname.</hi> <cb n="PEGM" /> —So, Sex. Peducaeus, <hi rend="ital">a prœtor in Sicily when Cicero was quœstor there</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:56:section=138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 56, § 138</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34364.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕdūcaeā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Peducœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">??ensus Peducaeanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:56:section=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 56, § 139</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34364.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕdūcaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Peducœan</hi>: Rogatio Peducaea de incestu, <hi rend="ital">by the people's tribune</hi>, Sex. Peducaeus (A. U. C. 640), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peduclus: <entryFree id="n34365" type="main" key="pe^du_clus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdūclus</orth>, <itype>another reading for pedicellus</itype>, v. h. v.</entryFree>
peduculatio: <entryFree id="n34366" type="gloss" key="pe^du_cu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdūcŭlātĭo</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">fqeiri/asis</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
peduculosus: <entryFree id="n34367" type="gloss" key="pe^du_cu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdūcŭlōsus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">fqeira/fios</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
peduculus: <entryFree id="n34368" type="main" key="pe^du_cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdūcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a louse;</hi> another form for pediculus, v. h. v.</sense></entryFree>
pedulis: <entryFree id="n34369" type="main" key="pe^du_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdūlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pes</etym>, <sense id="n34369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for the feet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasciae crurales pedulesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 26</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34369.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdūle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sole</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedale mensura est pedis: pedule vero sub pedibus praestat utilitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Diff. Voc. p. 2194" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Diff. Voc. p. 2194</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">pes, pedale, pedule, Not. Tir.—So, too, perh., pedulia should be read for pedulla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=230" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 230</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
pedum: <entryFree id="n34370" type="main" key="pe^dum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shepherd's crook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sheep-hook</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedum est baculum incurvum, quo pastores utuntur ad comprehendendas oves, aut capras a pedibus: cujus meminit etiam Vergilius in Bucolicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=249" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 249</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> p. 210 Müll.; cf. also: pedum virga incurvata, unde retinentur pecudum pedes, Serv Verg. l. l.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34371" type="main" key="Pe^dum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n34371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of remote antiquity in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Rome</hi>, prob. the mod. <hi rend="ital">Gallicano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:13" default="NO" valid="yes">13</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n34371.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕdānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Pedum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pedan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕdānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. praedium), <hi rend="ital">an estate near Pedum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 18, 3</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕdāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Pedum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Pedans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peduncularia: <entryFree id="n34372" type="main" key="pe^duncu^la_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕduncŭlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n34372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lousewort;</hi> cf. 1. pedicularius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pedunculus: <entryFree id="n34373" type="main" key="pe^duncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕduncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 2. pediculus.</entryFree>
pegae: <entryFree id="n34374" type="main" key="Pe_gae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēgae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">*phgai/</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n34374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fountain in Bithynia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peganon: <entryFree id="n34375" type="greek" key="pe_ga^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēgănon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ph/ganon</foreign>, <sense id="n34375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gardenrue</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 89</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34375.1" n="II" level="1"> Peganon orinon = <foreign lang="greek">ph/ganon o)reino/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">wild-rue</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pegasus: <entryFree id="n34376" type="main" key="Pe_ga^sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēgăsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ph/gasos</foreign>, <sense id="n34376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the winged horse of the Muses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who sprang from the blood of Medusa when she was slain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and with a blow of his hoof caused the fountain of the Muses</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Hippocrene</hi>) <hi rend="ital">to spring from Mount Helicon. Bellerophon afterwards caught him at the fountain of Pirene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Corinth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with the aid of his hoofs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroyed the Chimœra. But when Bellerophon wished to fly on the back of Pegasus to heaven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the latter threw him off and ascended to the skies alone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where he was changed into a constellation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 785</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 262</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:458" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 458</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 151" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Astr. 2, 18</bibl>.—Applied in jest to a swift messenger, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 25, 80</bibl>. —Of winged horses in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 30, § 72</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt mirae aves cornutae (in Africā) et equinis auribus Pegasi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 9</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n34376.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēgăsēïus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pegasean</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">poetic</hi>: melos, Pers. praef. 14. —</sense><sense id="n34376.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēgăsĕus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēgăsēus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pegasus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pegasean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 3, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>Hippocrene</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epigr. 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—Pegaseum stagnum, <hi rend="ital">a lake in lonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 31, § 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas Pegaseo corripiet gradu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with rapid step</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 385" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 385</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34376.3" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēgă-sis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Pegasus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pegasides undae,</quote> <trans><tr>the waters of Hippocrene</tr>, <tr>the fountain of the Muses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:59:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 59, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēgăsĭdes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the Muses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 1, 19.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēgă-sis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ph/gh/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a fountain-nymph</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pegasis Oenone Phrygiis celeberrima silvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34377" type="main" key="Pe_ga^sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēgăsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated jurist in the reign of the emperor Vespasian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=47" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:77" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 77</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34377.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pē-găsĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pegasian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus consultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2</bibl></cit>, tit. 23.</sense></entryFree>
pege: <entryFree id="n34378" type="greek" key="pe_ge_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēgē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">phgh/</foreign>, <sense id="n34378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fountain</hi>, v. l. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 33</bibl>, for Pegae, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
pegma: <entryFree id="n34379" type="greek" key="pe_gma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēgma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ph=gma</foreign>, <sense id="n34379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fixture</hi> <cb n="PELA" /> <hi rend="ital">made of boards</hi>, for use or ornament, belonging to a house. </sense><sense id="n34379.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">atricrum pegmata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in emptionem domus et specularia et pegmata cedere solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34379.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n34379.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bookcase</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 8</bibl>, a <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n34379.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A piece of wooden machinery in the theatre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which rose and fell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opened and shut of itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and with which players were suddenly raised aloft</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 16, § 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si automatum vel pegma vel quid tale aliud parum cessisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 34</bibl></cit>; Phaedr 5, 7, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:122" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:33:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 33, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carin. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pegmaris: <entryFree id="n34380" type="main" key="pegma_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pegmāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pegma</etym>, <sense id="n34380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the pegma</hi> or <hi rend="ital">theatrical machine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pegmares gladiatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
pegris: <entryFree id="n34381" type="main" key="pegris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pegris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n34381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-mussel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pejeratio: <entryFree id="n34382" type="main" key="pe_je^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pējĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pejero</etym>, <sense id="n34382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perjury</hi>, Salvian. Gub. Dei, 4, 16.</sense></entryFree>
pejero: <entryFree id="n34383" type="main" key="pe_je^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pējĕro</orth>, <itype>or</itype>, in the orig. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">perjūro</orth> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 19, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 5, 33</bibl>), and <orth extent="full" lang="la">per-jĕro</orth> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 9</bibl>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>per-juro</etym>, <sense id="n34383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swear falsely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to forswear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perjure one's self.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34383.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim falsum jurare pejerare (al. perjurare) est, sed quod ex animi tui sententiā juraris, sicut verbis concipitur more nostro, id non facere perjurium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 108</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illum verbis conceptis pejerasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:48:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 48, 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 13</bibl>: 5, 6, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui facile ac palam mentitur, pejerabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:20:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic putat esse deos, et pejerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:91" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per consulatum pejerat Vatinius,</quote> <trans><tr>by the consulship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:52:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 52, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stygias qui pejerat undas,</quote> <trans><tr>by the waters of the Styx</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:749" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 749</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alii in ipso Capitolio fallunt ac fulminantem perjurant Jovem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 21</bibl></cit> Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bel. lum pejerans,</quote> <trans><tr>oath-breaking</tr>, <tr>treaty-breaking war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:4" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34383.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> pass.: jus pejeratum, <hi rend="ital">a false oath</hi> (analog. to jus jurandum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et perjuratos in mea damna deos,</quote> <trans><tr>offended by perjury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 11, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34383.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to lie</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">perge: optime hercle perjuras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">da pignus, ni nune perjures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pejor: <entryFree id="n34384" type="main" key="pe_jor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pējor</orth>, <itype>us</itype>, v. 1. malus.</entryFree>
pejoro: <entryFree id="n34385" type="main" key="pe_jo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pējōro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> <etym>pejor</etym>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> (postclass.). <sense id="n34385.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to render worse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">statum suum pejorare, opp. to meliorem facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2</bibl></cit>, tit. 18.—</sense><sense id="n34385.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow worse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pejorans morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
pejus: <entryFree id="n34386" type="main" key="pe_jus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pējus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. male, under 1. malus.</entryFree>
pel: <entryFree id="n34387" type="main" key="pel"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pel</orth>... in composition before l, i. q. per ...</entryFree>
pelage: <entryFree id="n34388" type="main" key="pe^la^ge_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕlăgē</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <sense id="n34388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sea</hi>, v. pelagus.</sense></entryFree>
pelagia: <entryFree id="n34389" type="main" key="pe^la^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕlăgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. pelagius, II. A.</entryFree>
pelagicus: <entryFree id="n34390" type="greek" key="pe^la^gi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕlăgĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pela/giko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n34390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sea-</hi> (pure Lat. marinus): <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pelagium: <entryFree id="n34391" type="main" key="pe^la^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕlăgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. pelagius, II. B.<sense id="n34391.0" n="1" level="3"> † <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕlăgĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pela/gios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sea-</hi> (pure Lat. marinus): <cit><quote lang="la">pelagii greges piscium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagiae conchae,</quote> <trans><tr>sea-mussels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 29, 46, § 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: matrona ornata phaleris pelagiis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with pearls and corals</hi>, P. Syrus ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 55</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n34391.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n34391.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕlăgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of pearl-mussel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 37, 61, § 131</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34391.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕ-lăgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">purple color</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 38, 62, § 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:138" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 40, 64, § 138</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pelagius: <entryFree id="n34392" type="main" key="Pe^la^gi^us" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlăgĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous heretic of the fifth century</hi> A. D., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 175" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 175</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Haeres. 88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Haeres. 88</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlăgĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a follower of Pelagius</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 8, 5, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pelagones: <entryFree id="n34393" type="main" key="Pe^la^go^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlăgŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pelago/nes</foreign>, <sense id="n34393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the later Pœonians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 30</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34393.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlăgŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a district and city of the Pelagonians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the north of Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:28" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39" default="NO" valid="yes">39</bibl>; 45, 29.</sense></entryFree>
pelagus: <entryFree id="n34394" type="greek" key="pe^la^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕlăgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (Gr. <number>plur.</number> pelagē, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:619" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 619</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pe/lagos</foreign>, <sense id="n34394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sea</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose for Lat. mare): fervit aestu pelagus, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:39:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 39, 157</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagus remis petere coeperunt, Auct. B. Hisp. 40: in pelago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 432</bibl></cit>: pelagus tenuere rates, <hi rend="ital">the open sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the main.</hi> <pb n="1325" /> <cb n="PELI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelago Danaūm insidias Praecipitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelago dare vela patenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui fragilem truci Commisit pelago ratem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelago terrāque pericula passus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lustrare pelagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:608" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 608</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 10, 12, § 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:135" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:17" default="NO">12, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeviente pelago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vortices pelagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:1:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nantes lubrico pelagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagus Ciliciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 27, 5</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a mass of water</hi>, like the sea: <cit><quote lang="la">pelago premit arva sonanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 246</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34394.1" n="II" level="1"> Fig., for <hi rend="ital">an immense mass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">extent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam pauca excepta verba ex pelago sermonis pulli minus trita afferant,</quote> <trans><tr>the ocean of vulgar language</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:26:section=33" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, 26, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herodiani scriptorum pelagus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Ep. ad Jul. 4</bibl></cit>; cf. “a sea of troubles,” Shaksp.</sense></entryFree>
pelamis: <entryFree id="n34395" type="greek" key="pe_la^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēlămis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pēlamys</orth>, <itype>ydis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">phlamis</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">phlamu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n34395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young tunnyfish</hi> (before it is a year old; <cit><quote lang="la">afterwards called thynnus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 18, § 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:146" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:120" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pelasgi: <entryFree id="n34396" type="main" key="Pe^lasgi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlasgi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pelasgoi/</foreign>, <sense id="n34396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the oldest inhabitants of Greece</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who were spread likewise over a part of Asia Minor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and over Crete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Etruria</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 600</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:16" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:19" default="NO">19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2" default="NO">2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 50</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34396.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Greeks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ... Pelasgi ... Demisere neci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 562</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:281 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 281 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34396.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕ-lasgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlasgis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n34396.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An old name of the Peloponnesus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 4, 5, § 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34396.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A district of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 14, § 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34396.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The isle of Lesbos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 39, § 139</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34396.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlasgĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pelasgian</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Grecian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelasgiades urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34396.7" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlasgis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pelasgian</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Grecian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Lesbian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Sappho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 217</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34396.8" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlasgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pelasgian</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">Grecian</hi>: cum veter occubuit Priamus sub Marte Pelasgo, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 607</bibl> P (Ann. v. 17 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">pubes Pelasga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus,</quote> <trans><tr>Dodonean</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 541</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 132</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pelecanus: <entryFree id="n34397" type="greek" key="pe^le^ca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕlĕcānus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕlĭcānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peleka/n, peleka=s, peleka/nos</foreign>, <sense id="n34397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pelican</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Psa. 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:101:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 101, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pelecinon: <entryFree id="n34398" type="greek" key="pe^le^ci_non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕlĕcīnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peleki=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n34398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sundial in the shape of a two-edged axe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pelecinos: <entryFree id="n34399" type="greek" key="pe^le^ci_nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕlĕcīnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peleki=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n34399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hatchetvetch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a weed that grows among lentils</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 44, § 155</bibl>.—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕlĕcīna</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 168</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peleius: <entryFree id="n34400" type="main" key="Pe_le_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēlēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Peleus, A.</entryFree>
pelethronia: <entryFree id="n34401" type="main" key="pe^le_thro^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕlēthrŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Pelethronius <sense id="n34401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pelethronius: <entryFree id="n34402" type="main" key="Pe^le_thro^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlēthrŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a region of Thessaly inhabited by the Lapithœ and Centaurs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pelethronian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lapithae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus,</quote> <trans><tr>a spear cut on the Pelethronian mountains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:593" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 593</bibl></cit>: Pelethronia cithara, <hi rend="ital">of Achilles</hi> (because he, a native of Thessaly, had learned of Chiron the Thessalian to play the cithara), <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 17</bibl>. —As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕlēthrŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">centaury</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peleus: <entryFree id="n34403" type="main" key="Pe_leus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēleus</orth>, <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype> (<sense id="n34403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Peleos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:131" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 131</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Pelea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 17</bibl>; <case>voc.</case> Peleu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 104</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> Peleo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:15:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 15, 57</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*phleu/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a king of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Æacus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Telamon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-brother of Phocus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husband of Thetis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Achilles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and a sharer in the expedition of the Argonauts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 221</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 365</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:131" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 131</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n34403.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēlēïus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Peleian</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Achillean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:803" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 803</bibl></cit>: virgo, <hi rend="ital">of Achilles</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Briseis</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 210</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n34403.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēlīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n34403.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The son of Peleus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Achilles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelidae currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 350</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 548</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 808</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lites Inter Peliden et inter Atriden,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 605</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:280" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 280</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34403.4" n="2" level="3"> Also, <hi rend="ital">the son of Achilles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neoptolemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 263</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pelex: <entryFree id="n34404" type="main" key="pe_lex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēlex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. paelex.</entryFree>
pelia: <entryFree id="n34405" type="main" key="Pe^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 2. Pelias <sense id="n34405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
peliacus: <entryFree id="n34406" type="main" key="pe_li^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēlĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Pelion, A.</entryFree>
pelias: <entryFree id="n34407" type="main" key="Pe^li^as1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n34407.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pelias;</hi> v. 2. Pelias <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n34407.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēlĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pelion;</hi> v. Pelion, C. <cb n="PELL" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34408" type="main" key="Pe^li^as2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<case>nom.</case> Pelia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 201" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:276" default="NO">276</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*peli/as</foreign>, <sense id="n34408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Neptune and the nymph Tyro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Neleus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-brother of Æson</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Acastus. Being appointed by Æson guardian to his son Jason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he sought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when Jason grew up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rid himself of the charge by inciting him to join the Argonautic expedition. After Jason's return Pelias was slain by his own daughters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the artful instigation of Medea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 24" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 24</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 22, 34</bibl> (Trag. v. 286 Vahl.); id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:58:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 58, 217</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> v. 313</bibl> ib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 304</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:22" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 22</bibl> et saep.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlĭădes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the daughters of Pelias</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon Medea's promise to restore their father's youth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut him to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and boiled him in a caldron</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 7, 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 24" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pelicanus: <entryFree id="n34409" type="main" key="pe^li^ca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕlĭcānus</orth>, v. pelecanus.</entryFree>
pelicatus: <entryFree id="n34410" type="main" key="pe_li^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēlĭcātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pelli-, paeli-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>paelex</etym>, <sense id="n34410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cohabiting with a kept mistress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concubinage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ea est propter pelicatus suspitionem interfectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: Arinis uxorem pelicatus dolore concitatam, id. Scaur, 6, 9, B. and K. (Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 689</bibl> P.): <cit><quote lang="la">matris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Clu. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:4:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:18:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 18, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pelides: <entryFree id="n34411" type="main" key="Pe_li_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēlīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Peleus, B.</entryFree>
peligni: <entryFree id="n34412" type="main" key="Pe_ligni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēligni</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Paeligni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Central Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contiguous to the Frentani and Marrucini</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descendants of the Sabines</hi>, in the mod. <hi rend="ital">Abruzzo citeriore</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 41</bibl> sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">Niebuhr, Gesch. 1, p. 100 sq.: in Pelignos proficisci,</quote> <trans><tr>into the Pelignian territory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34412.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The country of the Peligni</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Pelignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 14, 14, § 33</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34412.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēlig-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Peligni</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pelignian</hi>: Peligna cohors, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 251</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 280 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:95" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 8</bibl></cit>: Peligni ruris alumnus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Ovid</hi>, who was born in the Pelignian city of Sulmo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 15, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:15:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 15, 8</bibl>: Pelignae anus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">sorceresses</hi> (because the Pelignians, as neighbors of the Marsians, were reputed to practise sorcery), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:60" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pelina: <entryFree id="n34413" type="gloss" key="Pelina"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pelina</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n34413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess of the Pelignians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 99, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">367, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pelinnaeus: <entryFree id="n34414" type="main" key="Pelinnaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pelinnaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Chios</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 38, § 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pelion: <entryFree id="n34415" type="main" key="Pe_li^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēlĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype> (<sense id="n34415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēlĭos</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelio, scanned as a dissyl. per syniz.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:495" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 495</bibl></cit>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ph/lion</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a high mountain in Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a continuation of Ossa</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Zagora</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 65, 65, § 162</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 281</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 513</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34415.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēlĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pelion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:308" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 308</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 321</bibl></cit>: trabs, i.e. <hi rend="ital">the Argo</hi> (because built of timber from Pelion), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 22, 12: <cit><quote lang="la">Peliaca carina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:417" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 417</bibl></cit>; cf. also: Peliaca cuspis, <hi rend="ital">of Achilles</hi>, cut on Pelion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">axis,</quote> <trans><tr>the chariot of Achilles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 414" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 414</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34415.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pelion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pelian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:15:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 15, 35</bibl></cit>: in nemore Pelio, Enn. ap. Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 2, 22, 34</bibl> (Trag. v. 280 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">in imitation, nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34415.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēlĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">that comes from Pelion</hi>: Pelias hasta, <hi rend="ital">the spear of Achilles</hi> (because its shaft came from Pelion), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Argo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:335" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 335</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēlĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a spear</hi>, Auct. Pan. ad Pis. 165.</sense></entryFree>
pella: <entryFree id="n34416" type="main" key="Pella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pellē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pe/lla</foreign>, <sense id="n34416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of remote antiquity in Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of Alexander the Great</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Alaklisi</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">Apostolus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:51" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 8, 2</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n34416.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pellaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pella</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pellœan.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34416.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus Pellaeo juveni non sufficit orbis,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>for Alexander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:168" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 168</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: ductor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:44:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 44, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pellaeus Eoum qui domuit Porum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> II. Cons. Honor. 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pellaeo ponte Niphaten adstrinxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:765" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 765</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pellaei proles vesana Philippi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34416.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34416.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Macedonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:1073" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 1073</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarissae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> II. Cons. Stil. 32</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34416.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Alexandrian</hi> (because Alexander founded Alexandria, in Egypt): <cit><quote lang="la">Pellaeae arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gula (because the Alexandrians were famous gourmands),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:85" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34416.6" n="3" level="3"> In a gen. <cb n="PELL" /> sense, <hi rend="ital">Egyptian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pellaei gens fortunata Canopi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Ptolemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 607</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:1016" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 1016</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">diadema,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceptra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:383" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <trans><tr>the palace of the Ptolemies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 475</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pellacia: <entryFree id="n34417" type="main" key="pella_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellācĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pellax</etym>, <sense id="n34417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an allurement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enticement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blandishment.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34417.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 443</bibl>, fallacia is the correct read.; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Wagner ad loc.): placidi pellacia ponti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1004" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1004</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34417.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">seduction</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Jovialis monumentum pellaciae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 171</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pellaeus: <entryFree id="n34418" type="main" key="Pellaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pellaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Pella, II.</entryFree>
pellarius: <entryFree id="n34419" type="main" key="Pella_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pellārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pellis</etym>, <sense id="n34419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that prepares skins</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a furrier</hi> (post-class.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=55" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 55</bibl> Müll.), Firm. Math. 4, 7; cf.: pellarius, <foreign lang="greek">pellora/fos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
pellax: <entryFree id="n34420" type="main" key="pellax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pellicio</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">poikilomh/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n34420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seductive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceitful</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postclass.; cf.: fallax, falsus): invidia pellacis Ulixi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 188</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pelleatus: <entryFree id="n34421" type="hapax" key="pelle^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pellis</etym>, <sense id="n34421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothed in a skin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">skins</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 17, 243</bibl> dub. (al. pileatus).</sense></entryFree>
