pellecebrae: <entryFree id="n34422" type="main" key="pelle^ce^brae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĕcĕbrae</orth>, v. perlecebrae.</entryFree>
pellectio: <entryFree id="n34423" type="hapax" key="pellecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pellego</etym>, <sense id="n34423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reading through</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 1</bibl> (al. per lectionem).</sense></entryFree>
pellectus: <entryFree id="n34424" type="main" key="pellectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from pellicio.</entryFree>
pellego: <entryFree id="n34425" type="main" key="pelle^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĕgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. perlego.</entryFree>
pellendones: <entryFree id="n34426" type="main" key="Pellendo^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pellendŏnes</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlendŏnes</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕ-londŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Celtiberian people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:112" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 20, 34, § 112</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 111, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pellene: <entryFree id="n34427" type="main" key="Pelle_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pellēnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pellh/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n34427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Achaia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Gulf of Corinth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Sicyon and Ægira</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 15</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34427.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pellēnaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pellenian; subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pellēnaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Pellene</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 6, § 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34427.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pellēnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pellenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Timocrates,</quote> <trans><tr>of Pellene</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pellesuina: <entryFree id="n34428" type="gloss" key="pelle^su^i_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĕsŭīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pellis-suo</etym>, <sense id="n34428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shop in which skins</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hides were dressed and sold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a furrier's shop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a leather-dresser's shop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a leather-shop</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=55" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 55</bibl> Müll.: pellesuma (leg. pellesuina), <foreign lang="greek">bursei=on</foreign> (<hi rend="ital">a tannery</hi>), Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
pellex: <entryFree id="n34429" type="main" key="pellex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. paelex.</entryFree>
pellicator: <entryFree id="n34430" type="gloss" key="pelli^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĭcātor</orth>, <itype>qui pellicit ad fraudem</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=204" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 204</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
pellicatus: <entryFree id="n34431" type="main" key="pelli^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĭcātus</orth>, v. pelicatus.</entryFree>
pelliceo: <entryFree id="n34432" type="main" key="pelli^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĭcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, v. pellicio.</entryFree>
pelliceus: <entryFree id="n34433" type="main" key="pelli^ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĭcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. pellicius.</entryFree>
pellicio: <entryFree id="n34434" type="main" key="pelli^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĭcĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">perlĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>lexi, lectum, 3</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĭcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 217</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 364</bibl> ib., prob. on account of the <sense id="n34434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> pellicuit, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 877</bibl> ib.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>per-lacio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to allure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inveigle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decoy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wheedle</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n34434.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): pellexit, in fraudem induxit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=207" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 207</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">is senem per epistolas Pellexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem imbecilli consilii pellexit ad se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 30, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum adulescentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum in servitutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Chaucos ad deditionem pellicerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militem donis, populum annonā, cunctos dulcedine otii pellexit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Florus pellicere alam equitum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animas instabiles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Pet. 2, 14.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec poterat quemquam placidi pellacia ponti Subdola pellicere in fraudem ridentibus undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1005" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1005</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1001" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1001</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34434.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: alienam segetem (alienas fruges, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to draw away the fruits of another's land to one's own</hi> by incantations and magical arts, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 8, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34434.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">meā quidem sententiā multo majorem partem sententiarum sale tuo et lepore et politissimis facetiis pellexisti,</quote> <trans><tr>have brought over to your side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 243</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pellicius: <entryFree id="n34435" type="main" key="pelli^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĭcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pellĭcĕus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pellis</etym>, <sense id="n34435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of skins</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicam et stragula pellicia habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34435.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĭcĭ-um</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">bai/th</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
pellico: <entryFree id="n34436" type="gloss" key="pelli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>pellex</etym>, <sense id="n34436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be a rival</hi>: pellico, <foreign lang="greek">zhleu/w</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
pellicula: <entryFree id="n34437" type="main" key="pelli^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pellis</etym>, <sense id="n34437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small skin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haedina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 36, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caprina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 11, 30, § 99</bibl></cit>. furtivae aurum Pelliculae, i.e. <hi rend="ital">the golden fleece</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haedorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:27:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 27, 16</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: pel <pb n="1326" /> <cb n="PELL" /> liculam curare, <hi rend="ital">to take care of one's skin</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">to make much of one's self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 38</bibl> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">cutem curare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4, 15</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">memento in pelliculā, cerdo, tenere tuā,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>stick to your last</tr>, <tr>keep within your own sphere</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:16:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelliculam veterem retinere,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>to keep to one's old courses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:116" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 116</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34437.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, = scortum, Auct. Atell. Inc. IX.</sense></entryFree>
pelliculatio: <entryFree id="n34438" type="hapax" key="pelli^cu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĭcŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pellicio</etym>, <sense id="n34438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an alluring enticement</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=242" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 242</bibl> Müll.; v. Meyer Orat. Fragmm. pp. 147 and 148.</sense></entryFree>
pelliculo: <entryFree id="n34439" type="main" key="pelli^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĭcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pellis</etym>, <sense id="n34439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover over with skins</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opercula vasorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:39:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:46:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 46, 5</bibl></cit>: pelliculare, <foreign lang="greek">dermatw=sai, u(podermati/zein</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
pelliger: <entryFree id="n34440" type="main" key="pelli^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pellis-gero</etym>, <sense id="n34440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clad in skins</hi> or <hi rend="ital">furs</hi>, Ven. Fort. 9, 5 (al. belligeri).</sense></entryFree>
pellinaeum: <entryFree id="n34441" type="main" key="Pelli^naeum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pellĭnaeum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n34441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:13" default="NO" valid="yes">13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:14" default="NO" valid="yes">14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pellinus: <entryFree id="n34442" type="main" key="pelli^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pellis</etym>, <sense id="n34442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of skins</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">femoralia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. 3:28" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. 3, 28</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
pellio: <entryFree id="n34443" type="main" key="pelli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a furrier</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">supellex pellionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 6</bibl>; Cod. Th. 13, 4, 2.</sense></entryFree>
pellion: <entryFree id="n34444" type="main" key="pelli^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n34444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> daphnoides, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pellionarius: <entryFree id="n34445" type="gloss" key="pelli^o_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellĭōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pellio</etym>, <sense id="n34445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who prepared skins for the use of soldiers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a military furrier</hi>, Inscr. Don. cl. 2, n. 1.</sense></entryFree>
pelliris: <entryFree id="n34446" type="gloss" key="pelliris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pelliris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pellis</etym>, <sense id="n34446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of skin</hi>: galerus, quia fiebat ex pelle, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=204" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 204</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
pellis: <entryFree id="n34447" type="main" key="pellis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<sense id="n34447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> pelle; <cit><quote lang="la">but pelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1270</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 22</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pe/lla, pe/las</foreign>, skin; cf. <foreign lang="greek">e)rusi/pelas, e)pipolh/</foreign>, surface; also, <foreign lang="greek">platu/s</foreign>, and Lat. palam</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hide</hi> (of a beast), whether on the body or taken off; <hi rend="ital">a felt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pelt</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n34447.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 6</bibl>: inaurata arietis, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 22, 34</bibl> (Trag. v. 285 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">rana rugosam inflavit pellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 23, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:13:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nationes caprarum pellibus vestitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam tu numquam vides nisi cum pelle caprinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelles pro velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulvique insternor pelle leonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 722</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelles perficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 56, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelles candidas conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 6, 13, § 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudes aureas habuisse pelles tradiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the human <hi rend="ital">skin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigida pellis Duraque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa atque pellis tota est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellis nostra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Thren. 5, 10</bibl></cit>; id. Job, 10, 11; 19, 20: pellem habere Hercules fingitur, ut homines cultus antiqui admoneantur. Lugentes quoque diebus luctus in pellibus sunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=207" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 207</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deformem pro cute pellem aspice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:192" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 192</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: detrahere pellem, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to pull off the mask</hi> which conceals a person's faults, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">introrsum turpis, speciosus pelle decorā,</quote> <trans><tr>with a showy outside</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 45</bibl></cit>: cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:14" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 14</bibl>: in propriā pelle quiescere, <hi rend="ital">to be content with one's own state</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 22</bibl> (v. pellicula): <cit><quote lang="la">caninam pellem rodere, said of lampooning a slanderer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:60:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 60, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellem pro pelle, et cuncta quae habet homo dabit pro animā suā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mutare potest Aethiops pellem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 13, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34447.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34447.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Leather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruptā calceus alter Pelle patet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:150" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 150</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34447.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A garment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">article of clothing</hi> made of skin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes in pelle natet,</quote> <trans><tr>in the shoe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 516</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:140" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 140</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34447.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A tent</hi> for soldiers (because it was covered with skins); usually in the phrase sub pellibus, <hi rend="ital">in the camp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non multum imperatori sub ipsis pellibus otii relinquatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub pellibus milites contineri non possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Caesar) sub pellibus hiemare constituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">durare sub pellibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellium nomine,</quote> <trans><tr>for covering shields</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34447.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Parchment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellibus exiguis artatur Livius ingens,</quote> <trans><tr>on little parchments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:190:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 190, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34447.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A drum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelles caedere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 24, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pellitus: <entryFree id="n34448" type="main" key="pelli_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pellis</etym>, <sense id="n34448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">covered with skins</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clad in skins</hi>: testes, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the witnesses from Sardinia</hi>, where skins were used for clothing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:22:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 22, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pelliti Sardi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11</bibl>, <cb n="PELL" /> 50, § <cit><quote lang="la">143: patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 110: <cit><quote lang="la">arator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 25: <cit><quote lang="la">pellitae oves,</quote> <trans><tr>sheep covered with skins for the sake of protecting their fine wool</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus,</quote> <trans><tr>garments of skin</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 226</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pello: <entryFree id="n34449" type="main" key="pello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pello</orth>, <itype>pĕpŭli, pulsum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n34449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi> pulserat, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 5, 19</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>kindred with Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pa/llw, pe/lw</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to beat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knock</hi> any thing or <hi rend="ital">at</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to push</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propel.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34449.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34449.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: trudo, percutio): pueri pulsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:18:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora pellite tonsis, Enn. ap. Fest. s. v. tonsa, p. 356 Müll. (Ann. v. 235 Vahl.): terram pede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter pede terram (in the tripudium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:18:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 18, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetu venientium pulsae fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: spumat sale rate pulsum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26</bibl> (Ann. v. 378 Vahl.); cf.: unda pulsa remis, Cic. Ac. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 162, 30</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vada remis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(arbor) ventis pulsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1096" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1096</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34449.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n34449.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To drive out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to thrust</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banish;</hi> esp. milit., <hi rend="ital">to drive back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discomfit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rout</hi> the enemy (freq. and class.; syn.: fugo, elimino, deicio); constr. with <case>abl.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, rarely with <hi rend="ital">de;</hi> also with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <hi rend="ital">abl. of the place</hi> from which one is repelled or driven back, but has not entered: <cit><quote lang="la">cum viri boni lapidibus e foro pellerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 10, 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">omnes ex Galliae finibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31, 11</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium ex arce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a foribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istum ab Hispaniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriis ab agris Pellor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 477</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a sacris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:624" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 624</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessores suis sedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 22, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem possessionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem civitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:1:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 4, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem regno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 35, 1, 3</bibl>.—Of inanim. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam de agro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 62, § 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta, quibus frigorum vis pelleretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placidam nives pectore aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:5:30" default="NO">3, 5, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calculos e corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 30, § 64</bibl></cit>.—Without indicating the place whence: <cit><quote lang="la">qui armis perterritus, fugatus, pulsus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes pelluntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:62:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 62, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">milites pulsi fugatique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 74:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 74, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsules tyrannorum injuriā pulsi,</quote> <trans><tr>driven out</tr>, <tr>banished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 26, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenienses Diagoram philosophum pepulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>— With <hi rend="ital">abl. of manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudendis Volneribus pulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 56</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si fugisset vulneratus a tergo, etc., Serv. ad loc.—Specifying the place whither: miles pellitur foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exsilium pulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34449.5" n="2" level="3"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to rout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put to flight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discomfit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum ejus ab Helvetiis pulsum et sub jugum missum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compluribus his proeliis pulsis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanos pulsos superatosque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, etc.; 1, 52; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:12:26" default="NO">2, 12, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34449.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set in motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inpello, sagitta pulsa manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 320</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34449.7" n="4" level="3"> Of a musical instrument, <hi rend="ital">to strike the chords</hi>, <hi rend="ital">play</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervi pulsi,</quote> <trans><tr>struck</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:54:199" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 54, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyra pulsa manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 205</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">classica pulsa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>blown</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34449.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34449.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impress</hi>, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">totum corpus hominis et ejus omnis vultus omnesque voces, ut nervi in fidibus, ita sonant, ut a motu animi quoque sunt pulsae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:57:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 57, 216</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of sound: Ille canit, pulsae referunt ad sidera valles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonat amnis, et Asia longe Pulsa palus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 702</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemadmodum visa nos pellerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 10, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">visa enim ista cum acriter mentem sensumve pepulerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:10:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 10, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (dictum) cum animos hominum aurisque pepulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:53:177" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 53, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">species utilitatis pepulit eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 10, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit saepe, ut pellantur animi vehementius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 36, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec habet ullum ictum, quo pellat animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:10:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla me ipsum privatim pepulit insignis injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum in Hispaniā juvenem nullius forma pepulerat captivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mediocri curā Scipionis animum pepulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsusque residerat ardor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longi sermonis initium pepulisti,</quote> <trans><tr>you have struck the chord of a long discussion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:87:297" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 87, 297</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34449.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n34449.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To</hi> <cb n="PELO" /> <hi rend="ital">drive out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to banish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maestitiam ex animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul a me dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsus Corde dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glandt famem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 216</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sitim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigoris vim tectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:300" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 300</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Col. poët. 10, 69: Phoebeā morbos arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:827" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 827</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:838" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 838</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolore pulsa est amentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:511" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpia crimina a vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbras noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:690" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 690</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:703" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 703</bibl></cit>; 15, 651.—</sense><sense id="n34449.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To beat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conquer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi> (very rare): si animus hominem pepulit, actum'st: animo servit, non sibi; <cit><quote lang="la">Sin ipse animum pepulit, vivit, victor victorum cluet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:27 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 27 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui pudicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pellonia: <entryFree id="n34450" type="main" key="Pello_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pellōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pello</etym>, <sense id="n34450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess who puts the enemy to flight</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 128</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pellos: <entryFree id="n34451" type="greek" key="pellos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pello/s</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">pe/llos, h, on</foreign>, <sense id="n34451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dark-colored</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 60, 79, § 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pelluceo: <entryFree id="n34452" type="main" key="pellu_ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellūcĕo</orth>, v. perluceo.</entryFree>
pelluciditas: <entryFree id="n34453" type="hapax" key="pellu_ci^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellūcĭdĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">perl-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pel lucidus</etym>, <sense id="n34453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">transparency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pellucidness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pellucidulus: <entryFree id="n34454" type="hapax" key="pellu_ci^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellūcĭdŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">perl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n34454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glittering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:69:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 69, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pellucidus: <entryFree id="n34455" type="main" key="pellu_ci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellūcĭdus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">perl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perluceo</etym>, <sense id="n34455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">transparent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pellucid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34455.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos induxit Epicurus perlucidos et perflabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:17:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 157</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arcanique fides prodiga perlucidior vitro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perlucidus, crenidatus, armillatus,</quote> <trans><tr>in a transparent garment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellucidus ostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:38:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 38, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34455.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very bright</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illustris et perlucida stella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 57, 130</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pelluo: <entryFree id="n34456" type="main" key="pellu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellŭo</orth>, v. perluo.</entryFree>
pelluvia: <entryFree id="n34457" type="gloss" key="pellu^vi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pellŭvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">pellŭvĭ-um</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n34457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel for washing the feet in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a foot-tub</hi>, Fest. pp. 160 and 161 Müll.; cf.: pelluvium, <foreign lang="greek">podonipth/r</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
pelopea: <entryFree id="n34458" type="main" key="Pe^lo^pe_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlŏpēa, Pĕlŏpēĭas, Pĕlŏpēis, Pĕlŏpēïus, Pĕlŏpēus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlŏpĭdae</orth>, v. Pelops.</entryFree>
pelopidas: <entryFree id="n34459" type="main" key="Pe^lo^pi^das"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlŏpĭdas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pelopi/das</foreign>, <sense id="n34459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Theban general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Epaminondas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 9</bibl>; Nep. Vit. Pelop.</sense></entryFree>
pelopius: <entryFree id="n34460" type="main" key="Pe^lo^pi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlŏpĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Pelops, 6.</entryFree>
peloponnesus: <entryFree id="n34461" type="main" key="Pe^lo^ponne_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlŏponnēsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pelopo/nnhsos</foreign> (the island of Pelops), <sense id="n34461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Peloponnesus</hi>, the southern part of Greece, so named from Pelops, who settled there, the modern <hi rend="ital">Morea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:4" default="NO">4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:7" default="NO">7</bibl>; 8; 2, 7, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 4, 5, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:22:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 28, 1</bibl>.—Prov.: nos juveni, ut rogas, suppeditabimus et Peloponnesum ipsam sustinebimus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">will exert ourselves to the utmost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">will try to make impossibilities possible</hi> (cf. the Greek proverb. <foreign lang="greek">*)arkadi/an m) ai)tei=s, me/ga m) ai)tei=s</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 12, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 5, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34461.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlŏponnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Peloponnesian.</hi> —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlŏponnensēs</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Peloponnesians</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:5:16" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 5, 16</bibl> (Jeep. Peloponnensii); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:29" default="NO">4, 13, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34461.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlŏponnēsĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Peloponnesian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:16" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:32:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 32, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 24, 84</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕ-lŏponnēsĭăci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Peloponnesians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34461.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlŏponnēsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Peloponnesian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Thras. 1, 3: circa Peloponnesia tempora,</quote> <trans><tr>about the time of the Peloponnesian war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlŏponnēsii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Peloponnesians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:6:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pelops: <entryFree id="n34462" type="main" key="Pe^lops"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlops</orth>, <itype>ŏpis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pe/loy</foreign>. <sense id="n34462.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Tantalus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Phrygia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Atreus and Thyestes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grandfather of Agamemnon and Menelaus; in his childhood he was served up to the gods by his father for food</hi> (truncatus Pelops, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:590" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 590</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">but was recalled to life by Jupiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who gave him an ivory shoulder in place of the one eaten by Ceres</hi> (umeroque Pelops insignis eburno, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 7</bibl>). <hi rend="ital">Being afterwards driven out of Phrygia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he went to Elis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and by artifice obtained the hand of Hippodamia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter</hi> <pb n="1327" /> <cb n="PELU" /> <hi rend="ital">of king Œnomaus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whose throne he succeeded. By means of the wealth which he brought with him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he acquired so great an influence that the entire peninsula was called</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the island of Pelops</hi> (Peloponnesus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 83:84" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 83, 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 107</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 27, 67</bibl>: Pelope natus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Thyestes</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl> (Trag. v. 397 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex Tantalo Pelops, ex Pelope autem satus Atreus, Trag. Rel. Inc. Fab. v. 102 Rib.: Pelopis genitor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Tantalus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 7</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n34462.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlŏpēïas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pelopian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Peloponnesian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelopeïadesque Mycenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 414</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34462.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlŏpēïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pelopian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Peloponnesian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelopeides undae,</quote> <trans><tr>the sea that surrounds the Peloponnesus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:285" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 285</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlŏpēĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Argive women</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:50" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 540</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34462.3" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlŏpēïus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*peloph/ios</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n34462.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pelopian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelopeius Atreus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Iphigenia</tr>, <tr>daughter of Agamemnon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:4:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 4, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Phrygia</tr>, <tr>the native country of Pelops</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 622</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlŏpēia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female descendant of Pelops</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34462.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Peloponnesian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelopeia sedes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the seat of Creon</tr>, <tr>king of Corinth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 891" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 891</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 2, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <trans><tr>the Peloponnesus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:117" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 117</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34462.6" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlŏpēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n34462.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pelopian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agamemnon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 33: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <trans><tr>the race of the Pelopides</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:17:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 17, 20</bibl></cit> (4, 18, 20): <cit><quote lang="la">P. Orestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:778" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 778</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕ-lŏpēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Pelops</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:361" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 361</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 291</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the name of a tragedy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:92" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 92</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34462.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Peloponnesian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelopea phalanx,</quote> <trans><tr>the Argive army</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:422" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 422</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in a more extended sense, for <hi rend="ital">Grecian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelopea ad moenia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to Greece</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 193</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34462.9" n="5" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlŏ-pĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the descendants of Pelops</hi> (notorious for their crimes), <hi rend="ital">the Pelopides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 86" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 86</bibl>; an old poet in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 28, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 30, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 11, 3</bibl> (applied by Cicero to the adherents of Cæsar).—</sense><sense id="n34462.10" n="6" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlŏpĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pelopian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelopia domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34462.11" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A slave's name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pelorias: <entryFree id="n34463" type="main" key="Pe^lo_ri^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlōrĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pelwria/s</foreign>, <sense id="n34463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory at the north-eastern extremity of Sicily</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Capo di Faro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque Peloriaden ... Lustrarat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:479" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 479</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peloris: <entryFree id="n34464" type="greek" key="pe^lo_ris1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕlōris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pelwri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n34464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large shell-fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the giant mussel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=77" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 77</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 9, 31, § 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:11:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:37:9" default="NO">10, 37, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34465" type="main" key="Pe^lo_ris2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlōris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pelwri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n34465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory on the north-eastern extremity of Sicily</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Capo di Faro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:15" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:16" default="NO">16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Peloridem accedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pelorus: <entryFree id="n34466" type="main" key="Pe^lo_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlōrus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕlōrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pe/lwros</foreign>, <sense id="n34466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory on the north-eastern coast of Sicily</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Capo di Faro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Peloros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelorus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:78" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 646</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34466.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕ-lōrĭtānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pelorian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pelta: <entryFree id="n34467" type="greek" key="pelta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pelta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pe/lth</foreign>, <sense id="n34467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">light shield in the shape of a half-moon</hi>, originally used by the Thracians and other barbarous people, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 490</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 743</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:96" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:80" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 5, 11, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hip. 402" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hip. 402</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 23, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peltasta: <entryFree id="n34468" type="greek" key="peltasta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peltasta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">peltasth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n34468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soldier armed with the</hi> pelta, <hi rend="ital">a peltast</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetrati, quos peltastas vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peltatus: <entryFree id="n34469" type="main" key="pelta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peltātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pelta</etym>, <sense id="n34469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">armed with the</hi> pelta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 21, 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amazon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:102:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 102, 5</bibl></cit>: cohors, Claud. Fescenn. de Nupt. Honor. et Mar. 33.</sense></entryFree>
peltifer: <entryFree id="n34470" type="main" key="pelti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peltĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pelta-fero</etym>, <sense id="n34470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">armed with the</hi> pelta: <cit><quote lang="la">puellae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Amazons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:761" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 761</bibl></cit>: maeotides, Sab. Ep. 2, 9.</sense></entryFree>
pelusium: <entryFree id="n34471" type="main" key="Pe_lu_si^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēlūsĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*phlou/sion</foreign>, <sense id="n34471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Egyptian city at the eastern mouth of the Nile</hi>, the modern Castle of <hi rend="ital">Tineh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 30, 45, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 19</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34471.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēlūsĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pelusiac</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linum, Plin 19, 1, 2, § 14: ostium Nili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 10, 11, § 64</bibl>: via, <hi rend="ital">leading to</hi> <cb n="PENA" /> <hi rend="ital">Pelusium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 29, 33, § 167</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34471.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēlū-sĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pelusian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34471.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēlūsĭōta</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēlūsĭō-tes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Pelusian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelusiotae caepe non edunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:8:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelusioten,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 2</bibl></cit>, n. 7.—</sense><sense id="n34471.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēlūsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pelusian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vada Pelusia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 466</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linteum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:9:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pelvicula: <entryFree id="n34472" type="gloss" key="pelvi^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pelvĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pelvis</etym>, <sense id="n34472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small basin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelvis, pelvicula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 164</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pelvis: <entryFree id="n34473" type="main" key="pelvis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pelvis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>acc.</case> pelvim; <sense id="n34473.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>, and cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 757</bibl> P.; <case>abl.</case> pelvi and pelve), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. pālavi; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pelli/s</foreign>, a bowl</etym>. <hi rend="ital">a basin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laver; acc.</hi> pelvim, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 543, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:ib. 28" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> ib. 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patulas effundere pelves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:271" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot pelves pulsari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:441" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 441</bibl></cit>; <case>abl.</case> pelvi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 27, § 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:104" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 8, 27, § 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentum in argenteā pelve,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 2, 5, § 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 13, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pemma: <entryFree id="n34474" type="greek" key="pemma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pemma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pe/mma</foreign>, <sense id="n34474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pastry</hi>: panis, pemma, lucuns, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 131, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum, pemma, lucuns,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 131, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
penarius: <entryFree id="n34475" type="main" key="pe^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>penus</etym>, <sense id="n34475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for provisions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 2, § 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a storehouse</hi>: a celando cellam appellarunt; <cit><quote lang="la">penariam, ubi penus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=162" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 162</bibl></cit> Müll.; also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a storehouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">granary</hi>: penora dicuntur res necessariae ad victum cotidianum, et locus eorum penarius, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=211" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 211</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
penas: <entryFree id="n34476" type="main" key="Pe^nas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, v. Penates.</entryFree>
penates: <entryFree id="n34477" type="main" key="Pe^na_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕnātes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype> (Penatis singulariter Labeo Antistius posse dici putat, quia pluraliter Penates dicuntur, cum patiatur proportio etiam Penas dici, ut optimas, primas, Antias, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=253" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 253</bibl> Müll. But the singular is never used; and for <foreign lang="greek">*dENAS</foreign> = <foreign lang="greek">*pENAS</foreign>, which some assume in Dion. Hal. 1, 68, it is probably most correct to read <foreign lang="greek">*d</foreign>IS <foreign lang="greek">*m*a*g*n*i*s</foreign>, v. Ambrosch, Studien und Andeut. vol. i. p. 231 sq.—<sense id="n34477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Acc. plur.</hi> PENATEIS, perh. Tab. Bant. lin. 22), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from the root pa, whence pascor, pabulum, pānis; also penus, and, through the notion of <hi rend="ital">a storehouse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inner chamber</hi>, also penes, penetro; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 270 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 270 sq.</bibl>; cf. Corss. Ausspr. 1, p. 425 sq.</etym>. </sense><sense id="n34477.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the Penates</hi>, old Latin guardian deities of the household, and of the state formed of a union of households, whose seat was originally in Lavinium; usually connected with di: IN VELIA APVD AEDEM DEVM PENATIVM, Inscr. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=54" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 54</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes deorum Penatium in Veliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">AEDEM DEVM PENATIVM IN VELIA, Monum. Ancyr.: di Penates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:1:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 1, 5 sq.</bibl></cit>: in mensā Penatium deorum, Naev. ap. Prob. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctis Penatium deorum Larumque familiarium sedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:5:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 5, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 5, 15</bibl>: MENS. IANVAR. SACRIFICANT. DIS. PENATIBVS, Calend. Farnes. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2, p. 380</bibl>: v. s. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1677</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1675</bibl> and 1678: <cit><quote lang="la">DIIS. DEABVS PENATIBVS FAMILIARIBVS ET IOVI CETERISQVE DIIBVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2118</bibl></cit>.—Without <hi rend="ital">di</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos Penates patriique dii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:20:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ilium in Italiam portans victosque Penatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impudens liqui patrios Penatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostia Mollivit aversos Penates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 23, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniqui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profugos posuistis Penates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 539</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 445</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">IVNIANI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1587</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, respecting the Penates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 68</bibl></cit>; Varr. and Nigid. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 123</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 296</bibl> and 325.—</sense><sense id="n34477.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a dwelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">home</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hearth</hi> (cf. Lares, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">Quintius a suis dis penatibus praeceps ejectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 26, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostris succede penatibus hospes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro Libycos populare penates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 527</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conducti penates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:75:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 75, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub uno tecto esse atque ad eosdem penates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 18</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">the hearth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammis adolere penatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 704</bibl></cit>.— Also, of <hi rend="ital">the cells</hi> of bees, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 155</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">the temple</hi> of a god, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:643" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 643</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
penatiger: <entryFree id="n34478" type="hapax" key="pe^na_ti^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnātĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>penatesgero</etym>, <sense id="n34478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing with him his guardian gods</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 450</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
penator: <entryFree id="n34479" type="hapax" key="pe^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>penus</etym>, <sense id="n34479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who carries provisions</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=237" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 237</bibl> Müll.; cf. Meyer Oratt. Fragmm. p. 51 ed. alt. <cb n="PEND" /></sense></entryFree>
pendens: <entryFree id="n34480" type="main" key="pendens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pendens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from pendeo.</entryFree>
pendeo: <entryFree id="n34481" type="main" key="pende^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pendĕo</orth>, <itype>pĕpendi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym><hi rend="ital">intr.</hi> of pendo, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n34481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hang</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hang down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be suspended.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34481.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, constr. with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>; also (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), with <case>abl.</case> alone, or with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: pendent peniculamenta, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 149, 32</bibl> (Ann. v. 363 Vahl.): in candelabro pendet strigilis, Varr. ap. <bibl
