default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 223, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arbore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:23:section=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 23, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittae pende, bant ab umero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 34</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">74: ex arbore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 26</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">66: ubera circum (pueri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 632</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrida pendebant molles super ora capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capiti patiar sacros pendere corymbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:23:35" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 23, 35</bibl></cit> (3, 28, 39): <cit><quote lang="la">telum ... summo clipei nequiquam umbone pependit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 544</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deque viri collo dulce pependit onus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:760" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 760</bibl></cit>.—Of garments: <cit><quote lang="la">chlamydemque ut pendeat apte, Collocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 733</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigridis exuviae per dorsum a vertice pendent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 577</bibl></cit>.—Of slaves, who were strung up to be flogged, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando pendes per pedes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi pendentem ferit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 48</bibl>: quid me fiet nunciam? <hi rend="ital">Theo.</hi> Verberibus caedere pendens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 2, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego plectar pendens, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 6, 20</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of suspended votive offerings: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus heu portis pendent mea noxia vota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:16" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 16</bibl> (24): <cit><quote lang="la">pendebatque vagi pastoris in arbore votum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pendebit fistula pinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multaque praeterea sacris in postibus arma, Captivi pendent currus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 184</bibl></cit>.—Of one who hangs himself, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:61:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 61, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e trabe sublimi triste pependit onus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pendentem volo Zoilum videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:77:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 77, 5</bibl></cit>.—Of any thing hung up for public notice; <cit><quote lang="la">of the names of persons accused,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 9</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of goods hung up, exposed for sale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">transf., of a debtor whose goods are exposed for sale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Prov.: pendere filo or tenui filo, <hi rend="ital">to hang by a thread</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be in great danger</hi>: hac noctu filo pendebit Etruria tota, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 153 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia sunt hominum tenui pendentia filo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:3:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 3, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 4, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34481.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf. immineo). </sense><sense id="n34481.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To hang in the air</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be suspended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to float</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overhang</hi>: per speluncas saxis structas asperis, pendentibus, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 37</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 245 Rib.); <cit><quote lang="la">imitated,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc scopulus raucis pendet adesus aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum siccā tellure licet, dum nubila pendent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi summo in fluctu pendent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illisaque prora pependit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 206</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dumosā pendere procul de rupe videbo (capros),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pendentes rupe capellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:51" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 51</bibl></cit>.—So of birds, which float or hover in the air: <cit><quote lang="la">olor niveis pendebat in aëra pennis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 379</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 145</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et supra vatem multa pependit avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 21" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 21</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of a rapid course: raraque non fracto vestigia pulvere pendent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:638" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 638</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34481.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To hang loosely together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be unstable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">movable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opertum (litus) pendeat algā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 233</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34481.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To hang about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tarry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">linger</hi> anywhere: <cit><quote lang="la">nostroque in limine pendes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 151</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34481.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To hang down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be flabby</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flaccid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without strength</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluidos pendere lacertos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pendentesque genas et aniles aspice rugas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:193" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 193</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34481.7" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To weigh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">offula cum duabus costis quae penderet III. et XX. pondo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cyathus pendet drachmas X., mna pendet drachmas Atticas centum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 34, 109, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucio Titio modios centum, qui singuli pondo centum pendeant, heres dato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:6:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 6, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34481.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34481.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hang</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rest</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">depend upon</hi> a person or thing (class.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, the simple <case>abl.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuorum, qui ex te pendent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes pendet ex fortunā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo verbo tota causa pendebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:25:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 25, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc omnis pendet Lucilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an ignoratis. vectigalia perlevi saepe momento fortunae pendere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 29, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salus nostra, quae spe exiguā extremāque pendet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam levi momento mea apud vos fama pendet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pendere ex alterius vultu ac nutu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblite, tuā nostram pendere salutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:109" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 109</bibl></cit>: in sententiis <pb n="1328" /> <cb n="PEND" /> omnium civium famam nostram fortunamque pendere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:41:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 41, 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ancipiti temporum mutatione pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 686</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deque tuis pendentia Dardana fatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:504" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 504</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannus, cum quo fatum pendebat amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:88" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34481.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hang upon</hi> a person's words, <hi rend="ital">to gaze fixedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">listen attentively to</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">haereo): (Dido) pendet iterum narrantis ab ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrantis conjux pendet ab ore viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab imagine pendet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:93" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 93</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervigil Arcadio Tiphys pendebat ab astro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:481" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attentus et pendens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex vultu dicentis pendent omnium vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 9:23:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 9, 23, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with a terminal clause: <cit><quote lang="la">e summo pendent cupida agmina vallo, Noscere quisque suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:457" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 457</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34481.11" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be suspended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrupted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discontinued</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">pendent opera interrupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutui datio interdum pendet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:1:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condictio pendet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:12" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7, 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio negotiorum gestorum pendeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:11" default="NO">24, 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pendet jus liberorum, propter jus postliminii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:12:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 12, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34481.12" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hang suspended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be ready to fall</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec amicum pendentem corruere patitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 16, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34481.13" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be in suspense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be uncertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irresolute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perplexed</hi> (cf. haesito): <cit><quote lang="la">animus tibi pendet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo suspensam et incertam plebem Romanam obscurā spe et caecā exspectatione pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne diutius pendeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia quam diu futurum hoc sit, non nimis pendeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 61:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 61, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortales pavidis cum pendent mentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 51</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq.: <cit><quote lang="la">pendere animi (locative case, v. Kühnast,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Synt. p. 39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Synt. p. 39</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">Clitipho cum spe pendebit animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exanimatus pendet animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:16:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 16, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pendeo animi exspectatione Corfiniensi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi pendeo et de te et de me,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 12</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego animi pendeo, quid illud sit negotii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostendis te pendere animi, quamnam rationem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 3, 9</bibl>.—Less freq.: pendere animo: atque animo noctu pendens eventa timebat, Cic. poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 204, 8</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">animis: quodsi exspectando et desiderando pendemus animis, cruciamur, angimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitis ac pendentibus animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> dub. (al. animi, v. Drak. ad loc.).—With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs innumera mentibus cum dimicationum curulium eventu pendentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 26</bibl></cit>.—Law t. t., to be <hi rend="ital">undetermined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to await decision</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pendente condicione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:200" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 200</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:1:186" default="NO">1, 186</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:3:179" default="NO">3, 179</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34481.14" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To have weight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">value</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona vera idem pendent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:30" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 30</bibl></cit> (Haas; al. pendunt).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pendens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n34481.15" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Hanging;</hi> in econom. lang., of fruits not yet plucked or gathered: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindemia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:44" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6, 1, 44</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34481.16" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pending;</hi> hence, in jurid, Lat., in pendenti esse, <hi rend="ital">to be pending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undecided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncertain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando in pendenti est, an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:17:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 17, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pendenti est posterior solutio ac prior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:58" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 46, 3, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:25" default="NO">7, 1, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pendenti habere aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>to regard a thing as uncertain</tr>, <tr>doubtful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:17:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 17, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
pendiculus: <entryFree id="n34482" type="gloss" key="pendi^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pendĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pendeo</etym>, <sense id="n34482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snare</hi>: pendiculus, <foreign lang="greek">a(rpedw/n, a(rpedw/nion</foreign>, Gloss. Cyrill.</sense></entryFree>
pendigo: <entryFree id="n34483" type="main" key="pendi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pendīgo</orth>, <itype>inis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, lit. <sense id="n34483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an internal tumor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abscess</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n34483.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pendiginem circumcides ad vivum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34483.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a hollow space</hi> inside of a statue: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacri pendigines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 201</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pendix: <entryFree id="n34484" type="gloss" key="pendix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pendix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, perh. i. q. pendigo: <sense id="n34484.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">A PENDICE CEDRI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 601, 10</bibl></cit> and 11.</sense></entryFree>
pendo: <entryFree id="n34485" type="main" key="pendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pendo</orth>, <itype>pĕpendi, pensum, 3</itype> (pendissent, for pependissent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <sense id="n34485.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">penderit for pependerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 14, 122</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. root <foreign lang="greek">sfad-, sfendo/nh</foreign>, a sling; Lat. funda</etym>.—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to hang down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to suspend;</hi> esp. of scales in weighing. </sense><sense id="n34485.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to weigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weigh out.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34485.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare: syn. penso, expendo): unumquodque verbum staterā aurariā pendere, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 455, 21</bibl>: da pensam lanam, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 369, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 15, § 39</bibl>, read repensum: aere gravi cum uterentur<cb n="PEND" />  Romani, penso eo, non numerato debitum solvebant, Fest. s. v. pendere, p. 208 Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">pensas examinat herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 270</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34485.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay out</hi> (because, in the earliest times, payments were made by weighing out the metals; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the preced.</ref></xr> the passage from Fest.; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): militis stipendia ideo, quod eam stipem pendebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=182" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 182</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Achaei ingentem pecuniam pendunt L. Pisoni quotannis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 25, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigal populo Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributum pro navibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coria boum in usus militares,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercedem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:15" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 15</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro pabulo pendunt,</quote> <trans><tr>pay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 65</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iterumque imperii nostri publicanis penditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 65</bibl></cit>.—As punishments consisted of fines in money or cattle: pendere poenas, supplicia, etc., signified <hi rend="ital">to pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undergo a penalty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pendere poenas solvere significat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=268" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 268</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Syrus mihi tergo poenas pendet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximas poenas pendo temeritatis meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis pro temeritate unius hominis suppliciorum pensum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis poenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:845" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 845</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenas violatae religionis sanguine et caedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna supplicia perfidiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:4:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen, culpam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:477" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 477</bibl></cit>.—Rarely in this signif. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to suffer</hi> any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">tuis nam pendit in arvis Delius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:445" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 445</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34485.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34485.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To weigh</hi> mentally, <hi rend="ital">to ponder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliberate upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decide</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: pensito, trutinor): vos eam (rem) suo, non nominis pondere penditote,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in philosophiā res spectatur, non verba penduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam ex veritate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem levi conjecturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34485.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi> a thing; with <hi rend="ital">gen. of the value</hi> (mostly ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">neque cum me magni pendere visum'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem tu vidisse beatus Non magni pendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec jam religio divum neque numina magni Pendebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unice unum plurimi pendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te volturium vocant: Hostisne an civis comedis, parvi pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:64 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 64 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequam hominis ego parvi pendo gratiam,</quote> <trans><tr>lightly esteem</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 29</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">parvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minoris pendo tergum illorum, quam meum,</quote> <trans><tr>care less for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem minoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem nihili,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non flocci pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese experturum, quanti sese penderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu illum numquam ostendisti quanti penderes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 103</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34485.7" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to A. 2.) <hi rend="ital">To pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">render</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">dignas pendere grates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:223" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 223</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34485.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to weigh</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">tantundem pendere par est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talentum ne minus pondo octoginta Romanis ponderibus pendat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:38:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 38, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 17, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, § 93; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 7, 12, § 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 6, 31, § 58</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:30" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 30</bibl>, read pendent).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, lit. <hi rend="ital">weighed;</hi> hence, trop., <hi rend="ital">esteemed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valued</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prized</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dear</hi> (as <pos>P. a.</pos> not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">utra condicio pensior, Virginemne an viduam habere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: ut nihil quicquam esset carius pensiusque nobis quam nosmetipsi, Taurus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 7</bibl>.—Esp., as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pensum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">something weighed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34485.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Weight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consideration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scruple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">importance</hi>, only in <hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi>: nihil pensi habere aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to lay no weight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stress upon a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to attach no value to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be indifferent to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">care nothing about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua parvi pendere, aliena cupere, ... nihil pensi neque moderati habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil pensi neque sancti habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 41, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque id quibus modis assequeretur, quicquam pensi habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prorsus neque dicere, neque facere quicquam pensi habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil pensi habuit, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut neque fas neque fidem pensi haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 15</bibl></cit>: aliquid ratum pensumque habere, Att. Capitol. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:12:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 12, 2</bibl>. —So, non pensi ducere (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:9:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 9, 3</bibl>.—Also, non adest or est alicui pensi: <cb n="PENE" /> nec mihi adest tantillum pensi jam, quos capiam calceos, <hi rend="ital">I don't care in the least</hi>, <hi rend="ital">am perfectly indifferent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed illis nec quid dicerent, nec quid facerent, quicquam umquam pensi fuisse,</quote> <trans><tr>they never cared at all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus si quicquam pensi umquam fuisset, non ea consilia de republicā habuissent,</quote> <trans><tr>if they had ever had regard for any considerations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 34</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34485.10" n="B" level="2"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">the wool weighed out to a slave to spin in a day;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a day's work in spinning</hi>, and, in gen., <hi rend="ital">spinning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a spinner's task.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34485.11" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pensum facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturna carpentes pensa puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmine quo captae dum fusis mollia pensa Devolvunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 348</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famulasque ad lumina longo Exercet penso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 412</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 15</bibl>, (4, 14), 15: <cit><quote lang="la">castrensia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>for military garments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 33: <cit><quote lang="la">pensa manu ducunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:65" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanificam revocas ad sua pensa manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:13:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 13, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a thread</hi> spun by the Fates: <cit><quote lang="la">durae peragunt pensa sorores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 181" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque in fine dies et inexorabile pensum Deficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:172" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 172</bibl></cit>: mortale resolvere, <hi rend="ital">to unbind his mortal thread</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to make him immortal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:137" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 137</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34485.12" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">office</hi> (so in Cic.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ministerium, munus, officium): pensum meum lepide accurabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">meum confeci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absolvere,</quote> <trans><tr>to perform one's duty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ad meum munus pensumque revocabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:30:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 30, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:46:section=109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 46, § 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis familiaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis sui peragere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pensē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considerately</hi> (post-class.): pensius, Flav. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 2:34" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 2, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pendulus: <entryFree id="n34486" type="main" key="pendu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pendŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pendeo</etym>, <sense id="n34486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hanging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hanging down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pendent</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; syn.: pensilis). </sense><sense id="n34486.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:386" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palearia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genae (ebrii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 142</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34486.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of places, <hi rend="ital">overhanging</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:112" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca et macriora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—Of persons, <hi rend="ital">hanging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swinging</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">putator arbustis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:229" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 229</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 122 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n34486.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">doubtful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hesitating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu fluitem dubiae spe pendulus horae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 110</bibl></cit>; Hadrian. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Saturn. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pene: <entryFree id="n34487" type="main" key="pe_ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēne</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. paene.</entryFree>
peneis: <entryFree id="n34488" type="main" key="Pe_ne_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēnēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. Peneus, A.</entryFree>
peneius: <entryFree id="n34489" type="main" key="Pe_ne_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēnēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Peneus, B.</entryFree>
peneleus: <entryFree id="n34490" type="main" key="Pe_ne^leus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēnĕleus</orth>, <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Hippalmus and Asterope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of Helen's suitors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 425</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 81" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 81</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 4, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
penelope: <entryFree id="n34491" type="main" key="Pe_ne^lo^pe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēnĕlŏpē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēnĕlŏpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (Pēnĕlŏpēa, = <foreign lang="greek">*phnelo/peia</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 68, 28</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*phnelo/ph</foreign>, <sense id="n34491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Icarius and Peribœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of Ulysses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of Telemachus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for her chastity and constancy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 126" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 5, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:56" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 56</bibl>: sponsi Penelopae, for <hi rend="ital">sensualists</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34491.1" n="B" level="2"> Transf, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a chaste wife</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:63:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 63, 6</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34491.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pē-nĕlŏpēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Penelope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Penelopean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Telemachus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the son of Penelope</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:14:36" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 14, 36</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēnĕlŏpēa</orth> = Penelope, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 70, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
penelops: <entryFree id="n34492" type="greek" key="pe_ne^lops"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēnĕlops</orth>, <itype>ŏpis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">phne/loy</foreign>, <sense id="n34492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of duck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> Meleagris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
penes: <entryFree id="n34493" type="main" key="pe^ne^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnĕs</orth>, <pos>prep.</pos> with <case>acc.</case> [from the root pa- of pasco, v. Penates], <sense id="n34493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the possession</hi> or <hi rend="ital">power of;</hi> connected only with names of persons, and freq. foll. its case (class.). </sense><sense id="n34493.1" n="I" level="1"> Chiefly to denote possession: virtus omnia in se habet; <cit><quote lang="la">omnia assunt bona, quem penes est virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 37</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri, quorum penes Cn. Pompeium omne judicium et potestas debet esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:19:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 19, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">penes quem est potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia non modo eos ornat, penes quos est, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:41:142" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 41, 142</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:258" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 74, 258</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod penes eos summam victoriae constare intellegebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si volet usus, Quem penes arbitrium est et jus et norma loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 72</bibl></cit>: me penes est <pb n="1329" /> <cb n="PENE" /> unum vasti custodia mundi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:119" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 119</bibl>. —So, penes se esse, <hi rend="ital">have control of one's self</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">e)n e(autw=| ei)=nai</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">penes te es?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 273</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">apud se esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 48</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n34493.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the presence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">power of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the house of</hi>, without the notion of possession: <cit><quote lang="la">sine dote, cum ejus rem penes me habeam domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thesaurum tuum Me esse penes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">isthaec jam penes vos psaltria'st?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi (servi) centum dies penes accusatorem cum fuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 22, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:76:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 76, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si penes servum tabulae fuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:5:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penes regem, noli velle videri sapiens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis causa malae est penes te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:226" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 226</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with an abstract object: plures ejus rei causas afferebat, potissimam penes incuriam virorum feminarumque, <hi rend="ital">the principal</hi> (<hi rend="ital">cause</hi>) <hi rend="ital">consisted in the indifference</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
penestae: <entryFree id="n34494" type="main" key="Pe^nestae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕnestae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pene/stai</foreign>, <sense id="n34494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Grecian Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34494.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕnestĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Penestœ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Penestiam exercitum reducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 19</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34494.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕnestĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Penestian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
penetrabilis: <entryFree id="n34495" type="main" key="pe^ne^tra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnĕtrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>penetro</etym>. <sense id="n34495.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that can be pierced</hi> or <hi rend="ital">penetrated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrable</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus nullo penetrabile telo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sit nulli penetrabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:653" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:1:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput haud penetrabile Nili,</quote> <trans><tr>inaccessible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:21" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34495.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piercing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrating</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Boreae penetrabile frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:649" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 649</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:857" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 857</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum penetrabilius in venas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querimonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo Dei est penetrabilior omni gladio ancipiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34495.2" n="III" level="1"> = penetralis (late Lat.): ad regni penetrabilia, Laurent. Hom. 1.</sense></entryFree>
penetral: <entryFree id="n34496" type="main" key="pe^ne_^tral"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnē^tral</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype>, v. penetralis <sense id="n34496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
penetralis: <entryFree id="n34497" type="main" key="pe^ne_^tra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnē^trālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>penetro</etym>. <sense id="n34497.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Piercing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrating</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 494</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 535</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmineus multo penetralior ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 382</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34497.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">inward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">internal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innermost</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeternumque adytis effert penetralibus ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abditi ac penetrales foci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:27:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 27, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di Penates ... ab eo, quod penitus insideret: ex quo etiam penetrales a poëtis vocantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 68</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">per penetrales deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 265" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 265</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 340" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phoen. 340</bibl>: penetrale sacrificium dicitur, quod interiore parte sacrarii conficitur: unde et penetralia cujusque dicuntur; <cit><quote lang="la">et penes nos, quod in potestate nostrā est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=250" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 250</bibl></cit> Müll.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnē^trāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnē^tral</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 2:34" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 2, 34</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>; usually in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnē^trālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the inner part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interior</hi> of any thing, esp. of a building; <hi rend="ital">the inside space</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an inner room</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; not in Cic. or Cæs.; cf. adytum). </sense><sense id="n34497.2" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34497.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">penetrale urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipsis penetralibus (Britanniae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparent Priami et veterum penetralia regum,</quote> <trans><tr>the inner chambers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in penetralibus regum ipsorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:104:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 104, 30</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">penetralia alta medio tecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni amnis penetralia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 574</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:501" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 501</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34497.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n34497.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sanctuary</hi>, esp. that of the Penates, <hi rend="ital">a chapel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">penetralia sunt penatium deorum sacraria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=208" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 208</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Capitolini Tonantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:51" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34497.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the Penates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guardian deities</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc vittas castumque refer penetrale parentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:62" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avi penetralia Turni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:668" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 668</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34497.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an inner place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secret place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a secret</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:56" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci aperire penetralia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia ex ipsis sapientiae penetralibus petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">3: animus secedit in loca pura ... Haec eloquentiae penetralia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penetralia animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 105</bibl></cit>.—With esp. reference to the signif. <hi rend="ital">sanctuary</hi> (v. supra, I. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut tantum intra suum penetral existimes adorandam (philosophiam),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctum penetral animi tui nesciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 2:34" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 2, 34</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnē^trālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inwardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">internally</hi> (post-class.), Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:597" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 597</bibl>. <cb n="PENI" /></sense></entryFree>
penetratio: <entryFree id="n34498" type="main" key="pe^ne^tra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnĕtrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>penetro</etym>, <sense id="n34498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a piercing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrating</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 160, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
penetrator: <entryFree id="n34499" type="main" key="pe^ne_^tra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnē^trātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who penetrates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a penetrator</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">domus alienae penetratores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 199" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 199</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamart. 883</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 20, 285</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
penetro: <entryFree id="n34500" type="main" key="pe^ne_^tro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnē^tro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root pa- of pasco; v. penates</etym>. <sense id="n34500.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34500.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">set</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">into</hi> any thing (ante- and post-class.; v. Brix ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 109</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n34500.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">penetrare pedem intra aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 49</bibl>: quo illic homo foras se penetrat ex aedibus? <hi rend="ital">to betake one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go</hi> in any direction, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ad pluris penetravi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> v. 14: <cit><quote lang="la">se in fugam,</quote> <trans><tr>to take to flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eam (specum) me penetro et recondo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:14:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 14, 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">To enter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea intra pectus se penetravit potio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.—In the same sense, mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae penetrata queunt sensum progignere acerbum,</quote> <trans><tr>having entered</tr>, <tr>having penetrated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 670</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1246" default="NO" valid="yes">1246</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34500.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Labeo Antistius in grammaticam sese atque dialecticam litterasque antiquiores altioresque penetraverat,</quote> <trans><tr>had penetrated into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:10:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34500.4" n="B" level="2"> Aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to pierce into</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to enter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrate</hi> any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n34500.5" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:894" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 894</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(semen) penetrare locos nequit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox aures penetrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 613</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem cum vini vis penetravit Acris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Illyricos sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nave Aegyptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediae cryptam Suburrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:106" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 106</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (India) penitus nequeat penetrari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 539</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penetratae cum victoriā Media, Albania, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:40:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 40, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penetrata limina montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:104" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter L. Lucullo penetratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34500.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">id Tiberii animum altius penetravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 69</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum penetrabat eos, posse haec, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>it entered their thoughts</tr>, <tr>it occurred to them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1262</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34500.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrate</hi> into any place or thing, <hi rend="ital">betake one's self</hi> (class.; cf.: pervado, permano). </sense><sense id="n34500.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in palaestram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad os Pelusii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipsum portum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:37:section=96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 37, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castra hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in artissimas fauces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per angustias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra vallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eo penetrasset,</quote> <trans><tr>thus far</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astra per caelum penetrantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penetrat vox ad aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad nares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eam speluncam penetratum cum signis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34500.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romuli animus haec ipsa in templa penetravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:22:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 22, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum ratio in caelum usque penetravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:61:163" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 61, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla res magis penetrat in animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:38:142" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 38, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penetrare ad sensum judicis opinionemque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo non ars penetrat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in provincias quoque grammatica penetraverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peneus: <entryFree id="n34501" type="main" key="Pe_ne_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēnēus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*phneio/s</foreign>, <sense id="n34501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a principal river in Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which rises in Mount Pindus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flows through the Vale of Tempe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and falls into the Gulf of Therma</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Selembria;</hi> in mythology, <hi rend="ital">a rivergod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the father of Cyrene and Daphne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:569 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 569 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 355</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 161" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:203" default="NO">203</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Voc.</hi> Penee, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 31</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34501.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēnēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*phnhi/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Peneus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Penean</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Nympha,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Daphne</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 504</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 472</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34501.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pē-nēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*phnh/i+os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Peneus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Penean</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Peneia Tempe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Daphne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:452" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Peneus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34501.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pēnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Penean</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 230</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
penicillum: <entryFree id="n34502" type="main" key="pe_ni^cillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēnĭcillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pēnĭcillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>peniculus</etym>, lit., a little tail; hence, acc. to diverse usage, <sense id="n34502.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A painter's brush</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pencil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caudam antiqui penem vocabant, ex quo est propter similitudinem penicillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:22:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 22, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">setae e penicillis tectoriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 17, 71, § 235</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 63</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n34502.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34502.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Painting.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 36</bibl>, <cb n="PENI" /> § 60.—</sense><sense id="n34502.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Style</hi> of composition: <cit><quote lang="la">modo mihi date Britanniam, quam pingam coloribus tuis, penicillo meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q.
