Fr. 2, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34502.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A roll of lint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tent</hi>, for wounds, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 11, 26, § 113</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34502.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small sponge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 45, 69, § 148</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34502.6" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of eye-salve</hi>, Inscr. Tōchon, Cachets des Ocul. pp. 66 and 71.</sense></entryFree>
peniculamentum: <entryFree id="n34503" type="main" key="pe_ni^cu^la_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēnĭcŭlāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>peniculus</etym>. <sense id="n34503.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">train</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 163</bibl> (11).—</sense><sense id="n34503.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a train</hi> of a garment (ante-class.): pendent peniculamenta unum ad quemque pedum, Enn. Ann. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 149, 32</bibl> (Ann. v. 363 Vahl.); Lucil. and Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 149, 33</bibl>, and 150, 3.</sense></entryFree>
peniculus: <entryFree id="n34504" type="main" key="pe_ni^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēnĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>penis</etym>, lit., a little tail; hence, <sense id="n34504.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A brush</hi> for removing dust (for which ox-tails and horse-tails were used): <cit><quote lang="la">(a pene) peniculi, quis calciamenta tergentur, quod e codis extremis faciebant antiqui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=230" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 230</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus nomen fecit Peniculo mihi, ideo quia mensam, quando edo, detergeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Quis iste'st Peniculus? Qui extergentur baxeae?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 40</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34504.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sponge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut peniculus novos exurgeri solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 4</bibl>; cf.: peniculi spongiae longae propter similitudinem caudarum appellatae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=208" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 208</bibl> Müll. —</sense><sense id="n34504.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A painter's brush</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pencil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34504.3" n="IV" level="1"> Perh., in an ambiguous sense, = membrum virile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peninsula: <entryFree id="n34505" type="main" key="pe_ninsu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēninsŭla</orth>, v. paeninsula.</entryFree>
peninus: <entryFree id="n34506" type="main" key="Peni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Penīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Penninus.</entryFree>
penis: <entryFree id="n34507" type="main" key="pe_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēnis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<case>abl.</case> peni, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=230" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 230</bibl> Müll.) [<foreign lang="greek">to\ pe/os</foreign>], <sense id="n34507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tail.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34507.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">caudam antiqui penem vocabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: ... lares ludentes peni pinxit bubulo, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=230" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 230</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n34507.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., = membrum virile, <hi rend="ital">the penis;</hi> also, by meton., for <hi rend="ital">lust</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hodie penis est in obscenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ganeo, manu, ventre, pene bona patria laceraverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:8" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:43" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 18</bibl>.—In a paron. with paene, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
penissime: <entryFree id="n34508" type="main" key="pe_nissi^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēnissĭmē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">paen-</orth>), v. paene <sense id="n34508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
penite: <entryFree id="n34509" type="main" key="pe^ni^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnĭtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. penitus <sense id="n34509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
penitus: <entryFree id="n34510" type="main" key="pe^ni^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root pa- of pasco; v. penates</etym>, <sense id="n34510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interior</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">exscrea usque ex penitis faucibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaturigo fontis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 178, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mente penitā conditum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, p. 259, 38.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> penitior pars domūs, App. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 599</bibl> P.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">advecta ex Arabiā penitissimā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 53</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in latebras abscondas pectore penitissimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scythae illi penitissimi,</quote> <trans><tr>the most remote</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Graecorum penitissimis litteris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 19</bibl></cit>. —As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnĭta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inmost parts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, § 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacri loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 3:43" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 3, 43</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms. </sense><sense id="n34510.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnĭtē</orth> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.), <hi rend="ital">inwardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">internally</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 178</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitissime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34510.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">class.</orth>), <hi rend="ital">inwardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">internally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the inside</hi> (cf.: prorsus, omnino). </sense><sense id="n34510.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34510.4" n="a" level="4"> In gen. (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">extra penitusque coacti Exagitant venti, Sev. Aetn. 317: penitusque deus, non fronte notandus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 309</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34510.5" n="b" level="4"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">deeply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">far within</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into the inmost part</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">saxum penitus excisum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:27:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 27, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum penitus abditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacent penitus defossa talenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 526</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitus convalle virenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitus terrae defigitur arbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitus penetrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Suevos penitus ad extremos fines se recepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitus in Thraciam se abdidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare retibus penitus scrutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:95" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34510.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">deeply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">far within. from the innermost depths</hi> or <hi rend="ital">recesses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitus ex intimā philosophiā hauriendam juris disciplinam putas,</quote> <trans><tr>from the very depths of philosophy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinio tam penitus insita,</quote> <trans><tr>so deeply rooted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene penitus sese dare in familiaritatem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:70:section=169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 70, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum penitus in venis et visceribus rei publicae,</quote> <trans><tr>in the very heart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demittere se penitus in causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34510.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (qs. through and through, to the bottom of a thing, i. e.), <hi rend="ital">thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wholly</hi>, <pb n="1330" /> <cb n="PENN" /> <hi rend="ital">entirely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utterly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">caput et supercilia penitus abrasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum hic confirmasse videtur religionem an penitus totam sustulisse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:42:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 42, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res penitus perspectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:23:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 23, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitus pernoscere omnes animorum motus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in memoriā meā penitus insederit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amittere hanc consuetudinem et disciplinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diffidere rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdere se ipsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:15:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 15, 49</bibl></cit>: te penitus rogo ne, etc., Q. Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitus toto divisos orbe Britannos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilecta penitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 21, 4</bibl></cit>.— Hence, to strengthen the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitus crudelior,</quote> <trans><tr>far more</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 17</bibl></cit>.—To strengthen the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir penitus Romano nomini infestissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:27:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 27, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34511" type="main" key="pe_ni_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēnītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>penis</etym>, <sense id="n34511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">having a tail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitam offam Naevius appellat absegmen carnis cum codā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=242" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 242</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 24, 230</bibl>; cf. Fest. s. v. penem, p. 230 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
penius: <entryFree id="n34512" type="main" key="Pe^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*penio/s</foreign>, <sense id="n34512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Colchis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 4, § 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
penna: <entryFree id="n34513" type="main" key="penna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">penna</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pinna</orth> (old forms, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pesna</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">petna</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=205:209" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 205, 209</bibl> Müll.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>orig. different words, penna for petna; root petor pat-; Sanscr. patāmi, to fly; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pe/tomai</foreign>, prop. a wing: pinna for pitna; cf. Sanscr. pitu; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pi/tus</foreign>, the pine-tree; Lat. pinus; cf.: spiculum, spina; <cit><quote lang="la">prop. a sharp point or end. To a late period an effort was made to distinguish them: nec miretur (puer), cur ... fiat a pinno quod est acutum, securis utrimque habens aciem bipennis, ne illorum sequatur errorem, qui, quia a pennis duabus hoc esse nomen existimant, pennas avium dici volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit> Halm: <cit><quote lang="la">pinnum enim antiqui acutum dicebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 19, 11</bibl></cit> dub. (v. 1. pennus): pinnas murorum, pennas avium dicimus, Flav. Cap. p. 2243 P. This dictum of the old grammar we have to retain, although the distinction is neither etymologically sound nor is it always practically true; cf. bipennis, Bramb. Lat. Orthog. p. 118. In MSS. and edd. the two forms have mostly been used indiscriminately in all meanings except II. D. E. F. infra, in which pinna only is found; cf. esp. Wagn. Orth. <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> p. 465</bibl>; Rib. prol. <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> p. 441 sq.</bibl>; Corss. Ausspr. 2, p. 270 sq.</etym>, <sense id="n34513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a feather</hi> on the body of a winged creature (syn. pluma). </sense><sense id="n34513.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34513.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Form penna: <cit><quote lang="la">sine pennis volare haud facile est: meae alae pennas non habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennarum tuarum nitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maduere graves aspergine pennae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:728" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 728</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34513.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Form pinna: <cit><quote lang="la">(aves) pullos pinnis fovent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinnarum caules omnium cavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 39, 34, § 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 42:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 42, 4</bibl>: ova parire solet genus pinnis condecoratum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=59" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 59</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 10 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">conveniebat corvos ex albis album pinnis jactare colorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:823" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 823</bibl></cit> Munro: <cit><quote lang="la">galli salaces, frequentibus pinnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam his rebus plumam pinnasque emundant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib. 9:14:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut statim per somnum hianti pinna in os inderetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34513.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34513.5" n="A" level="2"> In <number>plur.</number>: pennae (pinnae), <hi rend="ital">a wing</hi> (syn. ala). </sense><sense id="n34513.6" n="(a)" level="5"> Form pennae: <cit><quote lang="la">age tu, sis, sine pennis vola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatere in aëre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 676</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennis resumptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:664" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 664</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertere,</quote> <trans><tr>to fly away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:24:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 24, 22</bibl></cit> (3, 19, 6): penna, collect. for <hi rend="ital">the wings</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 376</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34513.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Form pinnae: <cit><quote lang="la">geminis secat aëra pinnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 48</bibl></cit> (282): <cit><quote lang="la">pinnas explicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 55</bibl></cit>: o Fides alma, apta pinnis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 104</bibl> (Trag. v. 410 Vahl.): densis ales pinnis obnixa, id. ap. Prob. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 31</bibl> (Ann. v. 148 ib.): (aquila) praepetibus pinnis (B. and K.; <cit><quote lang="la">al. pennis), Cic. poët. Div. 1, 47, 106. —Of bees: pinnis coruscant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 73</bibl></cit>. —Of locusts: <cit><quote lang="la">pinnarum stridor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 29, 35, § 104</bibl></cit>.—Of gnats: <cit><quote lang="la">pinnae culicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 2, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: pinnas incidere alicui, <hi rend="ital">to clip one's wings</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to deprive one of power</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rank</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 5</bibl>; so, decisis humilis pinnis, <hi rend="ital">with clipped wings</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with disappointed hopes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 50</bibl>; cf. the opp.: extendere pinnas, <hi rend="ital">to spread out one's wings</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to attempt great things</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34513.8" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a flying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flight.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34513.9" n="(a)" level="5"> Form penna: felicibus edita pennis, i. e. <cb n="PENN" /> <hi rend="ital">with a happy omen from the flight of birds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 10</bibl> (4, 9), 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:344" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 344</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:231" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 231</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34513.10" n="(b)" level="5"> Form pinna: <cit><quote lang="la">pinnā veras dare notas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:448" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 448</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34513.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A feather</hi> on an arrow (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n34513.12" n="1" level="3"> Form penna: <cit><quote lang="la">per jugulum pennis tenus acta sagitta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 258</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34513.13" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an arrow</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n34513.14" n="(a)" level="5"> Form penna: <cit><quote lang="la">cervos pennā petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:421" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 421</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34513.15" n="(b)" level="5"> Form pinna: <cit><quote lang="la">olor trajectus pinnā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:110" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34513.16" n="C" level="2"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">a pen.</hi>—Form penna: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumenta scribae, calamus et penna: sed calamus arboris est, penna avis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34513.17" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fin.</hi> —Form pinna, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 13, 15, § 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34513.18" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A pinnacle.</hi>—Form pinna: <cit><quote lang="la">turres contabulantur, pinnae loricaeque ex cratibus attexuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 72</bibl>: milites Metelli ... a pinnis hostis defendebant facillime funditore, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 159</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">templi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34513.19" n="F" level="1"> In mechanics. </sense><sense id="n34513.20" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A float</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bucket</hi> of a water-wheel.—Form pinna, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 10</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n34513.21" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A stop</hi> or <hi rend="ital">key</hi> of a water-organ.— <cit><quote lang="la">Form pinna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pennarium: <entryFree id="n34514" type="gloss" key="penna_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pennārĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>penna</etym>, <sense id="n34514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a receptacle for pens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pen-box</hi>: pennarium, <foreign lang="greek">kalamoqh/kh</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
pennatulus: <entryFree id="n34515" type="main" key="penna_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pennātŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n34515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [pennātus], <hi rend="ital">provided with wings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winged</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Mercurius in calvitio pennatulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pennatus: <entryFree id="n34516" type="main" key="penna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pennātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pinn-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>penna</etym>, <sense id="n34516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with wings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winged</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">hic Jovis altisoni subito pennata (al. pinnata) satelles, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 47, 106: apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 350</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennati equi, quos pegasos vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 30, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zephyrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 738</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <trans><tr>an arrow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 39, § 138</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pennāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. animalia), <hi rend="ital">winged creatures</hi>, <hi rend="ital">birds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennatorum infecunda sunt, quae aduncos habent ungues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 52, 73, § 143</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">Frustra jacitur rete ante oculos pennatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: voto pennatior, Auct. Itin. Alex. 69.—</sense><sense id="n34516.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: pennatas impennatasque agnas in Saliari carmine spicas significat cum aristis, et alias sine aristis ... (Aelius oves veteres et) agnas novas voluit intellegi, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=211" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 211</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
pennesco: <entryFree id="n34517" type="main" key="pennesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pennesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n34517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. inch.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to put forth feathers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become fledged</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pennifer: <entryFree id="n34518" type="main" key="penni^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pennĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>penna-fero</etym>, <sense id="n34518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">feathered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winged</hi> (post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">armi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 309</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
penniger: <entryFree id="n34519" type="main" key="penni^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pennĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pinnĭ-ger</orth> <etym>penna-gero</etym>, <sense id="n34519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">feathered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winged.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34519.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">genus animantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinniger rex apum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 16, 16, § 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34519.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sagittae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:375" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 375</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
penninus: <entryFree id="n34520" type="main" key="Penni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pennīnus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Penīnus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Poenī-nus</orth>; <sense id="n34520.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">the latter orthog. on account of the false derivation from Poeni, because Hannibal marched over this mountain to Italy,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 38, 6</bibl></cit> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 123</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from the Celtic Pen or Penn, summit, peak</etym>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Pennine Alps</hi> (between the Valais and Upper Italy, the highest point of which is the Great St. Bernard), <hi rend="ital">Pennine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 87</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also, juga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Great St. Bernard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 31:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 31, 9</bibl></cit>; also, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Penninus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:38" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <trans><tr>over the Great St. Bernard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">VALLIS POENIN,</quote> <trans><tr>the Valais</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 376, 6</bibl></cit>: DEO PENINO D. D., <hi rend="ital">the local deity of the Pennine Alps</hi>, Inscr. Spon. Misc. Ant. p. 85, n. 30; <cit><quote lang="la">called also, IVPPITER POENINVS, and simply, POENINVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 228 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
pennipes: <entryFree id="n34521" type="hapax" key="penni^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pennĭpēs</orth>, <itype>ĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>penna-pes</etym>, <sense id="n34521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has wings on his feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wing-footed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Perseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pennipotens: <entryFree id="n34522" type="main" key="penni^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pennĭpŏtens</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">pinn-</orth>; cf. Don. p. 1748 P.), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>penna-potens</etym>, <sense id="n34522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">able to fly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winged</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pennipotentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:878" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 878</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:789" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 789</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pennor: <entryFree id="n34523" type="hapax" key="pennor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pennor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n34523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [penna], <hi rend="ital">to put forth wings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become fledged</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Dracont.</author> 1, 262</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pennula: <entryFree id="n34524" type="main" key="pennu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pennŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little wing</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum pulli pennulis uti possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 129</bibl></cit>: tensa, Ven. Carm. 3, 22, 9; Hieron. adv. Pelag. 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 5, 8</bibl>. <cb n="PENS" /></sense></entryFree>
pennus: <entryFree id="n34525" type="gloss" key="pennus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pennus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pinna</etym>, <sense id="n34525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pointed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennum antiqui acutum dicebant: unde et avium pennae, quia acutae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 19, 11</bibl></cit> dub. (al. pinnum).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34526" type="main" key="Pennus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pennus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">T. Quinctius Pennus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pensa: <entryFree id="n34527" type="gloss" key="pensa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pensa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pendo</etym>, <sense id="n34527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a day's provisions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a ration for a day</hi>, Edict. Diocl. p. 19.</sense></entryFree>
pensabilis: <entryFree id="n34528" type="main" key="pensa_bilis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pensābilis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>penso</etym>, <sense id="n34528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">reparable</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">damna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 13, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pensatio: <entryFree id="n34529" type="main" key="pensa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pensātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n34529.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a weighing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weighing out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a recompense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compensation</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">multorum bonorum pensatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 141, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:2:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 2:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 5, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34529.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a weighing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pondering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consideration</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pense: <entryFree id="n34530" type="main" key="pense_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pensē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pendo, <sense id="n34530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pensiculate: <entryFree id="n34531" type="main" key="pensi^cu^la_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pensĭcŭlātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pensiculo <sense id="n34531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pensiculator: <entryFree id="n34532" type="gloss" key="pensi^cu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pensĭcŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pensiculo</etym>, <sense id="n34532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weigher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examiner</hi>: pensiculatores, <foreign lang="greek">e)cetastai/</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
pensiculo: <entryFree id="n34533" type="main" key="pensi^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pensĭcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pendo</etym>, <sense id="n34533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ponder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pensicula utrumque, modulareque (al. pensiculate moderateque),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 364</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Deo. Soc. p. 103 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl> —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pensĭcŭlātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">carefully</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pensiculate (al. pensim) scripta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pensilis: <entryFree id="n34534" type="main" key="pensi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pensĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pendeo</etym>, <sense id="n34534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hanging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hanging down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pendent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pensile</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; syn. pendulus). </sense><sense id="n34534.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">restim volo mihi emere, qui me faciam pensilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehetur pensilibus plumis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in a bed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:159" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lychnuchi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 3, 8, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <trans><tr>which are hung up to be preserved during the winter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 121</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 15</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in a double sense, alluding to the hanging of one's self,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas pensilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 24, § 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34534.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pensĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n34534.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Fruit hung up to be preserved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pensilia, ut uvae, mala, et sorba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:68" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:59:3" default="NO">1, 59, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34534.4" n="2" level="3"> (Sc. membra) = penis: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcre pensilibus peculiati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34534.5" n="II" level="1"> In archit., <hi rend="ital">supported on arches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hanging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pensile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabrica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horreum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 50, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 18, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horti,</quote> <trans><tr>hanging gardens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 14, 20, § 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:32" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 32</bibl>: balneae, <hi rend="ital">shower-baths</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vapor-baths</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 54, 79, § 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 11, 3</bibl>: tribus, <hi rend="ital">on movable seats</hi> (in the theatre), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 119</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pensim: <entryFree id="n34535" type="main" key="pensim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pensim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, another reading for pensiculate; v. pensiculo <sense id="n34535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pensio: <entryFree id="n34536" type="main" key="pensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pendo; lit., a weighing, weighing out; hence</etym>, <sense id="n34536.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A weight</hi> (only in Vitr.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34536.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a paying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">payment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a term of payment</hi> (class.; cf.: stipendium, pretium): pendere poenas solvere significat, ab eo, quod aere gravi cum uterentur Romani, penso eo, non numerato debitum solvebant: unde etiam pensiones dictae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=208" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 208</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil debetur ei, nisi ex tertiā pensione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altera tributi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 8, 12, § 32</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, sarcastically: etenim ista tua minime avara conjux, nimium debet diu populo Romano tertiam pensionem, i. e. <hi rend="ital">her third marriage</hi> (after your death), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 113</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34536.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n34536.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A tax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impost</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 39" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epit. 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34536.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Rent</hi> of a house or land (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">aedium pensio annua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:63" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34536.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Interest</hi> of money (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34536.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Compensation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 136, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pensitatio: <entryFree id="n34537" type="main" key="pensi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pensĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pensito</etym>. <sense id="n34537.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a paying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">payment</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Verr. 2:2:1:section=1" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Verr. 2, 2, 1, § 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Grat. Act. ad Const. 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34537.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34537.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A recompense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compensation</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 32, § 103</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34537.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An expense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expenditure</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">diurna pensitatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Hist. Sacr. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34537.4" n="C" level="2"> That with which payment may be made, <hi rend="ital">valuables</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa munera argenti et auri, et pensitationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 21, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pensitator: <entryFree id="n34538" type="main" key="pensi^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pensĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who weighs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">considers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a weigher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ponderer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considerer</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 1, 3</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1331" /> <cb n="PENT" /></sense></entryFree>
pensito: <entryFree id="n34539" type="main" key="pensi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pensĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>penso</etym>, <sense id="n34539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weigh out.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34539.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Orig. Gent. R. 22" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Orig. Gent. R. 22</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam aequā lance,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 7, 5, § 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34539.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34539.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To pay</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praedia, quae pensitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 6, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34539.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To weigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ponder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">think over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: penso, expendo, pondero): rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid morosissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malui omnia a te pensitari quam electa laudari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 14, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 15, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:27:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 27, 3</bibl></cit>.—With a <hi rend="ital">relative-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberius saepe apud se pensitato, an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu pensitares, quem potissimum eligeres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 15, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34539.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To compare</hi> by examining (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">philosophorum sectatores cum veteribus Pythagoricis pensitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:9:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incommoda cum emolumento spei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:13:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 13, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pensiuncula: <entryFree id="n34540" type="hapax" key="pensi^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pensĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pensio</etym>, <sense id="n34540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small payment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fenoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10 praef.</bibl></cit> 1.</sense></entryFree>
penso: <entryFree id="n34541" type="main" key="penso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">penso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>pendo</etym>, <sense id="n34541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weigh</hi> or <hi rend="ital">weigh out carefully</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.; not in Cic., for in Off. 2, 19, 68, conpensandum is the correct reading. Neither is it found in Plaut., Ter., Lucr., or Cæs.; syn.: pendo, expendo). </sense><sense id="n34541.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:153" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:51:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 51, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Gracchi caput auro pensatum,</quote> <trans><tr>paid for with its weight in gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:15:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odores ac purpurae et auro pensanda,</quote> <trans><tr>worth their weight in gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 73:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 73, 5</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">pensare aliquem eādem trutinā,</quote> <trans><tr>to weigh one in the same balance</tr>, <tr>judge one by the same standard</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34541.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34541.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To counterbalance</hi> with any thing, <hi rend="ital">to compensate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recompense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">requite;</hi> for the usual compensare: <cit><quote lang="la">exiguā turis impensā tanta beneficia pensaturi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficia beneficiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:9:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praematuram mortem immortali nominis sui memoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:88:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 88, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera et sanguis aviditate praedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 26</bibl>: vicem alicujus, <hi rend="ital">to supply the place of</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to compensate for</hi> a thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 8, 44, § 97</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">transmarinae res quādam vice pensatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <trans><tr>to shorten the way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 685</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34541.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punish</hi> with any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">nece pudorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia uno ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 936" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 936</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefarium concubitum voluntariā morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34541.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To purchase</hi> with any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:35" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriam damno militis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:115:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 115, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34541.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To exchange</hi> for any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">palatia caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:141" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiam moerore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 40, 41, § 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34541.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To allay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quench</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:111" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 111</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34541.8" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To weigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ponder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex factis, non ex dictis, amicos pensare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad consilium pensandum temporis opus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 51, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2:14" default="NO">8, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:33:2" default="NO">7, 33, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">singula animi consulta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stat pensata diu belli sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:223" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 223</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pensor: <entryFree id="n34542" type="main" key="pensor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pensor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who weighs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">considers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a weigher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examiner</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">elementorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 5:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 5, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; id. Civ. Dei, 15, 27.</sense></entryFree>
pensum: <entryFree id="n34543" type="main" key="pensum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pensum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. <itype>pendo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> B.</entryFree>
pensura: <entryFree id="n34544" type="hapax" key="pensu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pensūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pendo</etym>, <sense id="n34544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weighing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=183" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 183</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
pensus: <entryFree id="n34545" type="main" key="pensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from pendo.</entryFree>
pentachordus: <entryFree id="n34546" type="greek" key="penta^chordus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentăchordus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">penta/xordos</foreign>, <sense id="n34546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">five-stringed</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 962</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pentacontarchus: <entryFree id="n34547" type="main" key="penta^contarchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentăcontarchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">penthko/ntarxos</foreign>, <sense id="n34547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a commander of fifty men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pentacontarch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 3, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pentadactylus: <entryFree id="n34548" type="greek" key="penta^dacty^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentădactylus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pentada/ktulos</foreign>, <sense id="n34548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pentadactyl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of shell-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 147</bibl> Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n34548.1" n="II" level="1"> For pentaphyllon, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pentadoros: <entryFree id="n34549" type="main" key="penta^do_ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentădōros</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">penta/dwros</foreign>, <sense id="n34549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing five palms</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hand-breadths</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 14, 49, § 170</bibl>.‡ † <orth extent="full" lang="la">pentaĕtērĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <foreign lang="greek">pentaethrikos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of five years</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 499, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pentagonius: <entryFree id="n34550" type="greek" key="penta^go_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentăgōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pentagw/nios</foreign> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pentăgōnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">penta/gwnos</foreign>, <sense id="n34550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quinquangular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pentagonal.</hi>— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pentăgōnĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a pentagon</hi> (post-class.): pentagonii ratio, Auct. de <cb n="PENT" /> Limit. p. 257 Goes.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">pentăgōnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, for pentaphyllon, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pentameter: <entryFree id="n34551" type="greek" key="penta^me^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentămĕter</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">penta/metros</foreign> (containing five metrical feet), <sense id="n34551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pentameter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pentametri medio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:98" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 98</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">heroicus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 506</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">pentametrum elegum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 502</bibl></cit> ib.</sense></entryFree>
pentanummus: <entryFree id="n34552" type="greek" key="penta^nummus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentă-nummus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-nūmus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vox hibr., from <foreign lang="greek">pe/nte</foreign> and numus</etym>, <sense id="n34552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a silver coin of the value of five asses</hi>, i. q. quinarius (post-class.), Auct. de Limit. p. 265 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
pentapetes: <entryFree id="n34553" type="greek" key="penta^pe^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentăpĕtes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pentapete/s</foreign>, <sense id="n34553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">five-leaf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cinque-foil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinquefolium Graeci vocant pentapetes sive pentaphyllon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 62, § 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pentapharmacum: <entryFree id="n34554" type="greek" key="penta^pharma^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentăpharmăcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pentafa/rmakon</foreign>, <sense id="n34554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a meal consisting of five dishes</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Ael. Ver. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pentaphyllon: <entryFree id="n34555" type="greek" key="penta^phyllon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentăphyllon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">penta/fullon</foreign>, i. q. quinquefolium and pentapetes, <sense id="n34555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">five-leaved grass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cinque-foil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 62, § 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pentapolis: <entryFree id="n34556" type="greek" key="Penta^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pentăpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*penta/polis</foreign>. <sense id="n34556.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A district of five towns on the Dead Sea</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 10, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34556.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A district of Cyrene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Libyan Sea</hi>, Sex. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> Brev. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Verg. A. 4:42" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Verg. A. 4, 42</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pentă-pŏlĭtānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pentapolis</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to Cyrene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Cyrenaic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pentaprotia: <entryFree id="n34557" type="greek" key="penta^pro_ti_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentăprōtīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pentaprwtei/a</foreign>, <sense id="n34557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first five men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a board</hi> or <hi rend="ital">college of five superior officers</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 29, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pentaptota: <entryFree id="n34558" type="greek" key="pentapto_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentaptōta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">penta/ptwta</foreign>, in the later gramm., <sense id="n34558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nouns that have five cases</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pentaptotes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 288</bibl> P. al.</sense></entryFree>
pentas: <entryFree id="n34559" type="greek" key="pentas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">penta/s</foreign>, <sense id="n34559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number five</hi>, <hi rend="ital">five</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7</bibl>, §§ 735 and 745.</sense></entryFree>
pentasemus: <entryFree id="n34560" type="greek" key="penta^se_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentăsēmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">penta/shmos</foreign>, <sense id="n34560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has five marks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">divisions of time</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 978</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pentaspaston: <entryFree id="n34561" type="greek" key="pentaspaston"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentaspaston</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">penta/spaston</foreign>, <sense id="n34561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tackle with five pulleys</hi>, two in the lower block and three in the upper, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pentasphaerus: <entryFree id="n34562" type="greek" key="pentasphaerus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentasphaerus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pe/ntesfai=ra</foreign>, folium, <sense id="n34562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of costly spice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:16:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 16, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pentastichoe: <entryFree id="n34563" type="greek" key="pentasti^choe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentastĭchoe</orth> porticus = <foreign lang="greek">penta/stixoi</foreign>, <sense id="n34563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having five rows of columns</hi>, Treb. Gall. 18.</sense></entryFree>
pentasyllabus: <entryFree id="n34564" type="greek" key="penta^sylla^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentăsyllăbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pentasu/llabos</foreign>, <sense id="n34564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having five syllables</hi>, <hi rend="ital">five-syllabled</hi> (post-class.): pedes, Mall. Theod. de Metr. 2.</sense></entryFree>
pentateuchus: <entryFree id="n34565" type="greek" key="Penta^teuchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pentăteuchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pentă-teuchum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">penta/teuxos</foreign>, <sense id="n34565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the five books of Moses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Pentateuch</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 10</bibl> et saep.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pentathlos: <entryFree id="n34566" type="greek" key="pentathlos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentathlos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pe/ntaqlos</foreign>, <sense id="n34566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who practised the five exercises</hi> of pitching the quoit, running, leaping, wrestling, and hurling (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 57</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 8, 19</bibl>, §§ 68 and 72.‡ † <orth extent="full" lang="la">pentathlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pe/ntaqlon</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the contest of the five exercises</hi> of pitching the quoit, running, leaping, wrestling, and hurling (post-class.): pentathlum antiqui quinquartium dixerunt. Id autem genus exercitationis ex his quinque artibus constat, jactu disci, cursu, saltu, jaculatione, luctatione, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=211" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 211</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
pentatomon: <entryFree id="n34567" type="greek" key="penta^to^mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentătŏmon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">penta/tomos</foreign>, <sense id="n34567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">five-leaf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cinque-foil</hi>, i. q. quinquefolium and pentaphyllon, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pentecostalis: <entryFree id="n34568" type="greek" key="Pente_costa_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pentēcostālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Pentecoste</etym>, <sense id="n34568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Whitsuntide</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Pentecost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pentecostal</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">festum Pentecostale,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pentecoste: <entryFree id="n34569" type="greek" key="Pente_coste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pentēcostē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">penthkosth/</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">h(me/ra</foreign>), <sense id="n34569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fiftieth day after Easter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">WhitSunday</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pentecost</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 12, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Cor. 16, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pentelensis: <entryFree id="n34570" type="main" key="Pente^lensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pentĕlensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Pentelic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>; v. Pentelicus.</sense></entryFree>
pentelicus: <entryFree id="n34571" type="main" key="Pente^li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pentĕlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*penteliko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n34571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a mountain near Athens</hi> (in the demos of <foreign lang="greek">*pentelh/</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">celebrated for its while marble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pentelie</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hermae Pentelici,</quote> <trans><tr>of Pentelic marble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
penteloris: <entryFree id="n34572" type="greek" key="pente^lo_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentĕlōris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vox hibr. from <foreign lang="greek">pe/nte</foreign> and lorum</etym>, <sense id="n34572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having five thongs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">five stripes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
penteris: <entryFree id="n34573" type="greek" key="pente_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentēris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">penth/rhs</foreign>, <sense id="n34573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ship</hi> <cb n="PENU" /> <hi rend="ital">with five banks of oars</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 47; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. Afr. 62 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
pentethronicus: <entryFree id="n34574" type="main" key="pentethroni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentethronĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, a fictitious word: <sense id="n34574.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">pugna pentethronica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 25</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
pentheius: <entryFree id="n34575" type="main" key="Penthe_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Penthēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Pentheus, A.</entryFree>
penthemimeres: <entryFree id="n34576" type="greek" key="penthe_mi^me^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">penthēmĭmĕres</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-is</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">penqhmimerh/s</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">tomh/</foreign>; consisting of five halves, i. e. of 2 1/2 parts), <sense id="n34576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a part of a verse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of its first two feet and a half</hi>, esp. of a hexameter or iambic trimeter, <hi rend="ital">a penthemimeris</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 85</bibl> and 89; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 497, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2440" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2440</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
penthesilea: <entryFree id="n34577" type="main" key="Penthe^si^le_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Penthĕsĭlēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*penqesi/leia</foreign>, <sense id="n34577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a queen of the Amazons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who fought before Troy against the Greeks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and was slain by Achilles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 491</bibl> Serv.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl> (4, 10), 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pentheus: <entryFree id="n34578" type="main" key="Pentheus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pentheus</orth>, <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*penqeu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n34578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Echion and Agave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grandson of Cadmus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and king of Thebes;
