having treated with contempt the rites of Bacchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he was torn in pieces by his mother and her sisters when under the influence of the god</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 514</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 17</bibl> (4, 16), 24; 3 (4), 22, 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 19, 14</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34578.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Penthēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pentheus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Penthean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 22, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34578.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Penthēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*penqei=os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pentheus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Penthean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:575" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 575</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34578.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Penthīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*penqei/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Pentheus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:449" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 449</bibl> and 609.</sense></entryFree>
pentorobon: <entryFree id="n34579" type="greek" key="pento^ro^bon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pentŏrŏbon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pento/robon</foreign>, <sense id="n34579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> paeonia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 10, 60, § 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:29" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 4, 10, § 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pentri: <entryFree id="n34580" type="main" key="Pentri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pentri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Samnite people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
penu: <entryFree id="n34581" type="main" key="pe^nu"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnu</orth>, v. penus <sense id="n34581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
penuarius: <entryFree id="n34582" type="main" key="pe^nu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>penus</etym>, <sense id="n34582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for provisions</hi> (post-class. for penarius): <cit><quote lang="la">cellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:9:3:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 9, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
penula: <entryFree id="n34583" type="main" key="pe_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. paenula.</entryFree>
penultimus: <entryFree id="n34584" type="main" key="pe_nulti^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēnultĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. paenultimus.</entryFree>
penuria: <entryFree id="n34585" type="main" key="pe_nu_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēnūrĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">paenūrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pe/nomai</foreign>, to toil; <foreign lang="greek">pe/nhs</foreign>, poor; cf. <foreign lang="greek">spa/nis, pei=na</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n34585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">need</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scarcity</hi> of any thing (class.; syn.: inopia, egestas). </sense><sense id="n34585.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, esp. of want of the necessaries of life; constr. with or (less freq.) without a <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1007" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1007</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum necessariarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 25</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim est umquam penuria parvi,</quote> <trans><tr>he is never in want who requires but little</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penuriam temporum sustinere,</quote> <trans><tr>to supply their temporary wants</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in penuriā,</quote> <trans><tr>in time of scarcity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 13, 34, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">afflixit te penuriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">28, 48</bibl>.—Of want of other things: <cit><quote lang="la">civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna sapientium civium bonorumque penuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus generis (amicorum) est magna penuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri, vectigalium, pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:39:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 39, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34585.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 6, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivae vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
penus: <entryFree id="n34586" type="main" key="pe^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnus</orth>, <itype>ūs and i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕ-num</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnus</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n34586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> peneris, peniteris, only acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 2</bibl>; a collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕnu</orth>, Afran., acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 113</bibl> P.; cf. also Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 18</bibl>) [from the root pa- of pasco; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pate/omai</foreign>; v. penates]. </sense><sense id="n34586.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Store</hi> or <hi rend="ital">provision of food provisions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">victuals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim omne, quo vescuntur homines, penus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. other and different explanations in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1</bibl>, and tit.: <cit><quote lang="la">De penu legatā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne penus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sibi penum aliud ornet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condus promus sum, procurator peni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: magna penus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 219, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum penumque omnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:ib. 30" default="NO"><author>Pompon.</author> ib. 30</bibl></cit>: in penum erile, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 659</bibl> P.: aliquem penore privare, Auct. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">portet frumenta penusque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne situ penora mucorem contrahant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:4:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ea res innoxia penora conservet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avium cujusque generis multiplex penus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in locuplete penu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:73" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34586.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The innermost part</hi> of a temple of Vesta, <hi rend="ital">the sanctuary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">penus vocatur locus intimus in aede Vestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=250" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 250</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <pb n="1332" /> <cb n="PER" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in penum Vestae, quod, etc., irrupit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peparethus: <entryFree id="n34587" type="main" key="Pe^pa^re_thus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕpărēthus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pepa/rhqos</foreign>, <sense id="n34587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Peparethus</hi> (now <hi rend="ital">Piperi</hi>), <hi rend="ital">a small island in the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Cyclades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous for wine and oil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a town of the same name</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Scopelo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferax Peparethos olivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 470</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 28, 6</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34587.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕpărēthĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Peparethos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Peparethian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 7, 9, § 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peplis: <entryFree id="n34588" type="greek" key="peplis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peplis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pepli/s</foreign>, <sense id="n34588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of two plants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of which was also called</hi> porcilaca, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 20, 81, § 210</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">and the other</hi> syce, meconion, or mecon aphrodes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 12, 93, § 119</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peplium: <entryFree id="n34589" type="main" key="pepli^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peplĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pe/plion</foreign>, <sense id="n34589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medicinal plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a species of spurge</hi>, prob. the Euphorbia esula, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:19:115" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 19, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:6:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 4, 6, 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peplum: <entryFree id="n34590" type="greek" key="pe_^plum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pē^plum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pē^plus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pe/plon</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">pe/plos</foreign>, <sense id="n34590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the robe of state of Minerva</hi> at Athens, with which her statue was solemnly invested every five years at the Panathenaea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 67</bibl>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 480</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 21 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:56" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34590.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34590.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A splendid upper garment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a robe of state</hi>, either of gods or men (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Nupt. Honor. 123</bibl>: imperatorium, Treb. XXX. Tyrann. 23.—</sense><sense id="n34590.3" n="B" level="2"> Still more gen., <hi rend="ital">any broad upper garment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 387</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34590.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A disease of the eye</hi> (by which the eye is covered or veiled, as it were), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 13, 220</bibl> (al. plumbum).</sense></entryFree>
pepo: <entryFree id="n34591" type="greek" key="pe^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕpo</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pe/pwn, onos</foreign>, <sense id="n34591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of large melon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pumpkin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 23, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 2, 6, § 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 11, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pepticus: <entryFree id="n34592" type="greek" key="pepti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peptĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">peptiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n34592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that promotes digestion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peptic</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">medicinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 18, 76, § 201</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pepunculus: <entryFree id="n34593" type="gloss" key="pe^puncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕpuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pepo</etym>, <sense id="n34593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small pumpkin</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 168</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pepuzitae: <entryFree id="n34594" type="main" key="Pe^puzi_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕpuzītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of heretics</hi> (<hi rend="ital">also called</hi> Montanistae), <hi rend="ital">so named after the Phrygian town of</hi> Pepuza, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
per: <entryFree id="n34595" type="main" key="per1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">per</orth>, <pos>prep.</pos> with <case>acc.</case> (by solecism with <case>abl.</case> PER QVO, = <sense id="n34595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">whereby</hi>, Inscr. Miseni Repert. ex a. p. Chr. n. 159; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3300</bibl>) [kindr. with Gr. <foreign lang="greek">para/</foreign>; Sanscr. pāra, ulterior; Lith. pèr; cf.: parumper, paulisper; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Griech. Etym. p. 269" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Griech. Etym. p. 269</bibl>], denotes, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dia/</foreign>, motion through a space, or extension over it. </sense><sense id="n34595.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of space, <hi rend="ital">through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">through the midst of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throughout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all along</hi>: per amoena salicta raptare aliquem, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 40 Vahl.): inde Fert sese (equus) campi per caerula laetaque prata, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 3</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> v. 505</bibl> ib.): per amoenam urbem leni fluit agmine flumen, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 4</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> v. 177</bibl> ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">per membranas oculorum cernere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronam auream per forum ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iit hasta per tempus utrumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 418</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se per munitiones deicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per mare pauperiem fugiens, per saxa, per ignes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per Averna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 700</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per vias fabulari,</quote> <trans><tr>in all the streets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per totam urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui per provincias atque imperium tuum pecunias ei credidissent,</quote> <trans><tr>in the provinces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitati hospitaliter per domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via secta per ambas (zonas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 238</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">245</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nascuntur copiosissime in Balearibus ac per Hispanias,</quote> <trans><tr>in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 30, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per illas gentes celebratur,</quote> <trans><tr>throughout</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gustūs elementa per omnia quaerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:14" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 14</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Placed after the noun: viam per,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transtra per et remos et pictas abiete puppes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 663</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 692</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n34595.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34595.3" n="A" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throughout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">during</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod des bubus per hiemem,</quote> <trans><tr>the winter through</tr>, <tr>during the winter</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla res per triennium, nisi ad nutum istius, judicata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla abs te per hos dies epistula ... venerat,</quote> <trans><tr>during these days</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per decem dies ludi facti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per idem tempus,</quote> <trans><tr>during</tr>, <tr>at</tr>, <tr>in the course of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:286" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 83, 286</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per noctem cernuntur sidera,</quote> <trans><tr>during the night</tr>, <tr>in the night-time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 10, 7, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per inducias,</quote> <trans><tr>during</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 2</bibl></cit>: per <cb n="PER" /> multa bella, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ludos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per comitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per somnum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 45</bibl></cit>: per tempus, <hi rend="ital">during</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">at the right time</hi>, = in tempore, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 3, 16</bibl>.—So distr.: <cit><quote lang="la">per singulas noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 22</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per haec,</quote> <trans><tr>meanwhile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34595.4" n="B" level="2"> To indicate the agent, instrument, or means, <hi rend="ital">through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by means of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuerunt injurias per vos ulcisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detrimenta publicis rebus per homines eloquentissimos importata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ais? vulgo occidebantur? Per quos? et a quibus?</quote> <trans><tr>by whom? and by whose command?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae domi gerenda sunt, ea per Caeciliam transiguntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 51, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nefarium stuprum non per illum factum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—Placed after its case: <cit><quote lang="la">Exerce vocem, quam per vivis et colis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 13</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: per fidem decipere, fallere, etc. (= datā fide): per fidem deceptus sum, <hi rend="ital">through confidence</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in my host who betrayed me</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:39:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 39, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 46, 3</bibl>.—So, per se, per te, <hi rend="ital">through himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of himself</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo per se cognitus, sine ullā commendatione majorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:25:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 25, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per me tibi obstiti, = solus,</quote> <trans><tr>by myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis per te tibi consulis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per se solus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 49</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ipse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ipsos per se sine P. Sullā facere potuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 24, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum per se, suā vi, sua naturā, sua sponte laudabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:15:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 15, 50</bibl></cit>.—To form an adverb. expression, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">through</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">non dubitavi id a te per litteras petere,</quote> <trans><tr>by letter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per summum dedecus vitam amittere,</quote> <trans><tr>in the most infamous manner</tr>, <tr>most infamously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per iram facere aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>in anger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:37:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 37, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per commodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 29, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. II. A. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">per commodum rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 25, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:57:1" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 57, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ludum et jocum,</quote> <trans><tr>sporting and jesting</tr>, <tr>in sport and jest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:60:section=155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 60, § 155</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 70</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">181: per vim,</quote> <trans><tr>forcibly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per dolum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per otium,</quote> <trans><tr>at leisure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 58, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteris copiis per otium trajectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibo per otium capto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:55:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 55, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per tumultum = tumultuose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:45:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 45, 14</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34595.5" n="C" level="2"> To designate the reason, cause, inducement, etc., <hi rend="ital">through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the sake of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per metum mussari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui per virtutem perit, at non interit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum antea per aetatem nondum hujus auctoritatem loci attingere auderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per aetatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Druso propinquanti quasi per officium obviae fuere legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nihil eum delectaret, quod aut per naturam fas esset aut per leges liceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum per valetudinem posses, venire tamen noluisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: per me, per te, etc., <hi rend="ital">as far as concerns me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">you</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">si per vos licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:prol. 12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. prol. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per me vel stertas licet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 93</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sin hoc non licet per Cratippum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:7:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides publica per sese inviolata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per me ista pedibus trahantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per me stetisse, quo minus hae fierent nuptiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si per suos esset licitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inspicere vitia nec per magistros nec per aetatem licebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 24</bibl></cit>. —Hence, in oaths, entreaties, asseverations, etc., by a god, by men, or by inanimate or abstract things, <hi rend="ital">by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">IOVRANTO PER IOVEM, etc., Tab. Bant. lin. 15: per pol saepe peccas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si per plures deos juret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est enim, per deos, optabilius sapientiā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per deos atque homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:55:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 55, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per dexteram te istam oro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per tuam fidem Te obtestor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc te per amicitiam et per amorem obsecro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per pietatem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per comitatem edepol, pater, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 52</bibl></cit>.—In this signif. often separated from its object: <cit><quote lang="la">per ego vobis deos atque homines dies, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ego te deos oro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ego te, fili ... precor quaesoque, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ego has lacrimas ... te Oro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 314</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:5:7" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:841" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 841</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per vos Tyrrhena faventum Stagna deum, per ego et Trebiam cineresque Sagunti Obtestor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:79 sq" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 79 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:658" default="NO">1, 658</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:367" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 367</bibl>.—With <cb n="PERA" /> <hi rend="ital">ellips. of object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per, si qua est ... Intemerata fides, oro, i. e. per eam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 142</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 903</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per, si quid merui de te bene, perque manentem amorem, Ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:854" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 854</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes to indicate an apparent or pretended cause or inducement, <hi rend="ital">under the show</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pretext of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under color of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui per tutelam aut societatem aut rem mandatam aut fiduciae rationem fraudavit quempiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves triremes per causam exercendorum remigum ad fauces portus prodire jussit,</quote> <trans><tr>under pretext of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. causa: per speciem alienae fungendae vicis suas opes firmavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per simulationem officii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34595.6" n="D" level="2"> In composition, it usually adds intensity to the signif., <hi rend="ital">thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfectly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceedingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very</hi> (very often in Cicero's epistolary style, and in new-formed words, as perbenevolus, percautus, percupidus, perbelle, perofficiose, pergaudeo; see these articles): pervelle, perfacilis, peramanter; sometimes it denotes the completion of an action, e. g. perorare, peragere; <cit><quote lang="la">sometimes it is repeated: perdifficilis et perobscura quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 12, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:43:158" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 43, 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 3 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but also: perexiguā et minuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:13:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percautus et diligens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:6:section=18 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 6, § 18 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:page=410" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. p. 410</bibl>.—It frequently occurs in tmesi: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis ista sunt pergrata perque jucunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:47:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 47, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per mihi mirum visum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 49, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per enim magni aestimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi te quam primum per videre velim, = videre pervelim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Platoni per fuit familiaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:18:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per, inquit, magister optime, exoptatus mihi nunc venis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—Per quam (also perquam), <hi rend="ital">very</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceedingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extremely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quam breviter perstrinxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:49:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 49, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quam modica civium merita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:60" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quam velim scire,</quote> <trans><tr>very much indeed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">PARENTES PER QVAM INFELICISSIMI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 953, 2</bibl></cit>.—As one word: <cit><quote lang="la">illorum mores perquam meditate tenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propulit perquam indignis modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat perquam onerosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perquam honorificum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 3:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—Separated by an intervening word: <cit><quote lang="la">per pol quam paucos reperias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—Placed after the word it governs; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, I. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> and II. B.</sense></entryFree>
pera: <entryFree id="n34596" type="greek" key="pe_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pēra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ph)ra</foreign>, <sense id="n34596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wallet</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">mantica, loculus): peras imposuit Juppiter nobis duas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum baculo perāque senex, of a Cynic philosopher,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:53:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 53, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 287, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:17:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 17, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 10, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
perabjectus: <entryFree id="n34597" type="main" key="pe^rabjectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-abjectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n34597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deeply humbled</hi>, Cypr. Laud. Mart. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
perabsurdus: <entryFree id="n34598" type="main" key="pe^rabsurdus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-absurdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very absurd</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec quia videntur perabsurda, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 15, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 8, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 11, 30</bibl>.—Separated: <cit><quote lang="la">per enim absurdum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; v. per, II. D.</sense></entryFree>
peraccommodatus: <entryFree id="n34599" type="hapax" key="pe^raccommo^da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-accommŏdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very suitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very convenient</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per fore accommodatum tibi, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peracer: <entryFree id="n34600" type="main" key="pe^ra_cer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ācer</orth>, <itype>ācris, ācre</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very sharp;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 4</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 1</bibl>, the correct reading is cor acre; v. Ritschl ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
peracerbus: <entryFree id="n34601" type="main" key="pe^ra^cerbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ăcerbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very harsh</hi> to the taste. </sense><sense id="n34601.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva peracerba gustatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34601.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very painful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi peracerbum fuit, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peracesco: <entryFree id="n34602" type="main" key="pe^ra^cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ăcesco</orth>, <itype>ăcŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n34602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become sour through and through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoroughly sour;</hi> hence, trop., <hi rend="ital">to become vexed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow vexatious</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">ita mihi pectus peracuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc, hoc est, quod peracescit: hoc est demum quod percrucior,</quote> <trans><tr>that vexes me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peractio: <entryFree id="n34603" type="main" key="pe^racti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕractĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perago</etym>, <sense id="n34603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a finishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completion.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34603.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: peccati, Hilar. in Psa. 118, 4, 8.—</sense><sense id="n34603.2" n="II" level="1"> Aetatis, transf. from the stage, qs. <hi rend="ital">the last act of the drama</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 85</bibl> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 64</bibl>: fabulam aetatis peregisse, and 19, 70: peragenda fabula est).</sense></entryFree>
peractus: <entryFree id="n34604" type="main" key="pe^ractus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from perago.</entryFree>
peracute: <entryFree id="n34605" type="main" key="pe^ra^cu_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrăcūtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. peracutus <sense id="n34605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
peracutus: <entryFree id="n34606" type="main" key="pe^ra^cu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ăcūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very sharp.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34606.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">falx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:24:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 24, 5</bibl></cit> (dub.).—</sense><sense id="n34606.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of sound, <hi rend="ital">very clear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">penetrating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:241" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 68, 241</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34606.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <pb n="1333" /> <cb n="PERA" /> <hi rend="ital">very keen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very acute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very penetrating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum peracutus esset ad excogitandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:39:145" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 39, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 76, 264</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:44:section=108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 44, § 108</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrăcūtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very sharply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very acutely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with great keenness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moveri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 9, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peracute querebare, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reperisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peradpositus: <entryFree id="n34607" type="main" key="pe^radpo^si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕradpŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. perapp-.</entryFree>
peradulescens: <entryFree id="n34608" type="hapax" key="pe^ra^du^lescens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ădŭlescens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very young</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo peradulescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 21, 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peradulescentulus: <entryFree id="n34609" type="hapax" key="pe^radu^lescentu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-adŭlescentŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl>, <sense id="n34609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very young man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peraea: <entryFree id="n34610" type="main" key="Pe^raea1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕraea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*perai/a</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">gh=</foreign>, the land beyond the sea or river; hence), <sense id="n34610.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A strip of land in Caria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">along the coast opposite to Rhodes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and subject to the Rhodians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35" default="NO" valid="yes">35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:18" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34610.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A part of Palestine beyond the Jordan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the capital of which was Gadara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 14, 15, § 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34611" type="main" key="Pe^raea2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĕraea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*perai/a</foreign>. <sense id="n34611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Æolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colony of the Mityleneans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 21, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peraedificatus: <entryFree id="n34612" type="main" key="pe^raedi^fi^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-aedĭfĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">completely built</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peraequatio: <entryFree id="n34613" type="main" key="pe^raequa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕraequātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>peraequo</etym>, <sense id="n34613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making perfectly equal</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n34613.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similitudinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34613.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an equalizing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equal distribution</hi> of taxes, Cod. Th. 5, 4, 3.</sense></entryFree>
peraequator: <entryFree id="n34614" type="main" key="peraequa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peraequātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an equalizer</hi>, esp. of taxes, <hi rend="ital">an equal distributor</hi> (jurid. Lat.), Cod. Th. 13, tit. 11; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11</bibl>, tit. 57; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 361, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peraeque: <entryFree id="n34615" type="main" key="pe^raeque_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-aequē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n34615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quite equally</hi> or <hi rend="ital">evenly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hos numquam minus, ut peraeque ducerent dena milia HS ex melle recipere esse solitos,</quote> <trans><tr>on an average</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque hoc peraeque in omni agro decumano reperietis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:52:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 52, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cum peraeque omnes, tum acerbissime Boeotii senserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 35, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:21:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 21, § 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terna milia peraeque in singulos menses,</quote> <trans><tr>uniformly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peraequo: <entryFree id="n34616" type="main" key="pe^raequo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-aequo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make quite equal</hi> (post-Aug.): octogenae stirpes ...septenos culeos peraequarent, <hi rend="ital">filled up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">yielded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produced</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:10" default="NO">3, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphoras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contracturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum lunari computatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peraestimo: <entryFree id="n34617" type="main" key="pe^raesti^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-aestĭmo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to esteem greatly</hi> (post-class.), Cod. Th. 6, 29, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
peragito: <entryFree id="n34618" type="main" key="pe^ra^gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ăgĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n34618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hunt about greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to harass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n34618.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34618.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementius peragitati ab equitatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetna majore vi peragitata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:37" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34618.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to stir up</hi> any thing, esp. a liquid: <cit><quote lang="la">ut permisceatur medicamen rutabulo ligneo peragitare conveniet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:24:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mustum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:19:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 19, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34618.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34618.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peragitatur enim messis mense Maio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 47, § 169</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
perago: <entryFree id="n34619" type="main" key="pe^ra^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ăgo</orth>, <itype>ēgi, actum</itype> (<sense id="n34619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> paragier, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Orig. 7, p. 1</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n34619.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To thrust through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pierce through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfix</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Theseus latus ense peregit,</quote> <trans><tr>transpierced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ardenti quercu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:146" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 146</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">externa peragi dextrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:364" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 364</bibl></cit>.—Hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:37:16" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 37, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34619.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To pass through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traverse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">freta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sol duodena peregit Signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 618</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34619.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To drive about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annoy</hi> a person or thing (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pecora peragens asilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58, 2</bibl></cit>: totum Sempronium usque eo perago, ut, etc., Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n34619.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To carry through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go through with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n34619.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: exsequor, conficio, patro): multum egerunt, qui ante nos fuerunt, sed non peregerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 64:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 64, 8</bibl></cit>: carmen tubā solā peregit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> ad Stat. Th. 11, 56</bibl> (Ann. v. 508 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">fabulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 19, 70</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 64</bibl> (and v. peractio): <cit><quote lang="la">comitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13</bibl></cit>. 210: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 653</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">coeptum iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:188" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona,</quote> <trans><tr>to finish distributing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 362</bibl></cit>: mandata, Ov. <cb n="PERA" /> M. 7, 502: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatem, vitam, aevum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 485</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:640" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 640</bibl></cit>; also, <hi rend="ital">to exhaust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot viros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 34</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, = <foreign lang="greek">dia/gein</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to pass one's life</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:138" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 138</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quis non peractum esse cum Pompeio crederet?</quote> <trans><tr>that the war with Pompey is ended</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:53" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34619.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in jurid. Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">reum,</quote> <trans><tr>to continue a prosecution till the defendant is condemned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:6:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 6, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to prosecute to the end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">receptus est reus, neque peractus, ob mortem opportunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34619.7" n="IV" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to work</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">work up</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n34619.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum,</quote> <trans><tr>to till</tr>, <tr>cultivate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:693" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 693</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum,</quote> <trans><tr>to digest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 60, 86, § 183</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34619.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">describe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatus peragit deinde postulata...Haec paucis verbis carminis concipiendique jurisjurandi mutatis peragit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 6 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis auspicia,</quote> <trans><tr>to mention</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res pace belloque gestas,</quote> <trans><tr>to describe</tr>, <tr>treat of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum perago tecum pauca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res tenues, tenui sermone peractas,</quote> <trans><tr>delivered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peragrans: <entryFree id="n34620" type="main" key="pe^ra_^grans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrā^grans</orth>, v. peragro, II.</entryFree>
peragranter: <entryFree id="n34621" type="main" key="pe^ra_^granter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrā^granter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. peragro <sense id="n34621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
peragratio: <entryFree id="n34622" type="hapax" key="pe^ra_^gra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrā^grātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>peragro</etym>, <sense id="n34622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wandering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">travelling through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a traversing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:23:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 23, 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peragratrix: <entryFree id="n34623" type="main" key="pe^ra_^gra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrā^grātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that wanders</hi> or <hi rend="ital">travels through</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">coelicolarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 588</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peragro: <entryFree id="n34624" type="main" key="pe^ra_^gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ā^gro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (<sense id="n34624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part.</hi> peragratus, in the <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> signif.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>per and ager</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to wander</hi> or <hi rend="ital">travel through</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traverse</hi>, etc. (class.; cf. percurro). </sense><sense id="n34624.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 258</bibl></cit>.—Of bees: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus silvasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca avia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:926" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 926</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in peragrandā Aegypto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:93" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peragratis partibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 19, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of sailing: <cit><quote lang="la">litora Liburnicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eques Romanus qui et commercia ea et litora peragravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 3, 11, § 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:7:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:10:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 10, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34624.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Dep.</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peragratus omnes Germaniae partes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:97:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 97, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34624.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traverse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spread through; to search through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne immensum peragravit mente animoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia omnes peragravit insulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 13, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus res gestae omnes gentes terrā marique peragrassent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:35:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 35, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 22, 53</bibl>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">per</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator ita peragrat per animos hominum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gula peragrans,</quote> <trans><tr>a roving appetite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:16:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 16, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrăgranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">in roving about</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peragror: <entryFree id="n34625" type="main" key="pe^ra^gror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕrăgror</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. peragro, I. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.</entryFree>
peralbus: <entryFree id="n34626" type="main" key="pe^ralbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-albus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n34626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very white</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, p. 171, 10.</sense></entryFree>
peramans: <entryFree id="n34627" type="main" key="pe^ra^mans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ămans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [amo], <sense id="n34627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very loving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very fond</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo peramans semper nostri fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 8</bibl></cit>, b, 3.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĕr-ămanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very lovingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perofficiose et peramanter aliquem observare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
